targetString: On 24 March 2020, uNdunankulu wase-China u-Li Keqiang wabika ukuthi ukusabalala kwezibonelo ezidluliselene ngaphakathi bekuvinjiwe nokuthi ukuqubuka bekulawuliwe e-China.
en-mt: On 24 March 2020, China's Prime Minister Li Keqiang reported that the spread of internally transmitted examples had been prevented and that the outbreak was controlled in China.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: Ngosuku olufanayo lokwenziwa lula kwemikhawulo yokuhamba e-Hubei, ngaphandle kwe-Wuhan, izinyanga ezimbili ngemva kokuphoqelelwa kokuvala phansi. I-Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs yamemezela ngo-26 March 2020 ukuthi ukungena kwabanama-visa noma abanezimvume zokuhlala kuzomiswa kusukela ngo-28 March kuqhubeke, ngaphandle kwemininingwane eqondile yokuthi lenqubomgomo izophela nini.
en-mt: On the same day of ease of travel restrictions in Hubei, outside Wuhan, two months after the forced lockdown. The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that the entry of visa holders or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, without specific details on when the policy would end.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: Labo abafisa ukungena e-China kuzomele bafake isicelo sama-visas kumahhovisi amanxusa ase-China noma kumahhovisi amanxusa e-China.
en-mt: Those wishing to enter China must apply for visas at China's embassy or embassy in China.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: Uhulumeni wase-China ukhuthaze amabhizinisi nezimboni ukuthi zivule kabusha ngo-30 March, futhi wahlinzekela izinkampani ngogqozi lwezishuqulu zemali. I-State Council imemezele usuku lokuzila oluqala ngemizuzu emithathu yesikhathi sokuthula ezweni lonke ngo-10:00 4 April, okuqondana ne-Qingming Festival, yize uhulumeni omkhulu ucele imikhaya ukuthi ibonise ukwazisa kwayo nge-inthanethi ukuze kuqaphelwe ukuzihlukanisa ngokomzimba bese kugwenywe ukuqubuka kabusha kwe-COVID-19.
en-mt: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and industries to reopen on 30 March, and provided companies with a boost for financial stimulus. The State Council has announced a day of mourning starting with three minutes of national peace time at 10:00 4 April, which is in line with the Qingming Festival, although the central government has asked families to show their awareness online to avoid physical isolation and avoid a COVID-19 re-outbreak.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: I-COVID-19 yaqinisekiswa ukuthi isisabalale yaya e-South Korea ngo-20 January 2020 ivela e-China.
en-mt: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: Abemeleli bezezempilo zezwe babike ukuphakama okuqaphelekayo kwezibonelo eziqinisekisiwe ngo-20 February, okubhekwa ngokuyinhloko njengomphumela wombuthwano wase-Daegu weqembu elisha lenkolo elaziwa ngokuthi i-Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
en-mt: The country's health representatives reported a noticeable rise in confirmed cases on 20 February, which is primarily regarded as the result of the Daegu gathering of a new religious group known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: Abazinikele ku-Shincheonji bevakashele e-Daegu bevela e-Wuhan basolwa ngokuba ngabasusi bokuqubuka.
en-mt: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were accused of being rioters.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-22 February, phakathi kwabalandeli abangu-9,336 besonto, u-1,261 noma okungenani u-13% wabika izimpawu. I-South Korea yamemezela isixwayiso sezinga eliphezulu ngo-23 February 2020.
en-mt: As of 22 February, among the week's 9,336 followers, 1,261 or at least 13% reported symptoms. South Korea announced a high-level warning on 23 February 2020.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: Ngo-28 February, izibonelo eziqinisekisiwe ezidlule ku-2,000 zabikwa e-Korea, zakhuphuka zafika ku-3,150 ngo-29 February.
en-mt: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed samples were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: Zonke izizinda samasosha e-South Korea ziye zavalwa ngemuva kokuthi ukuhlola kuthole amasosha amathathu enesifo ngokuqinisekisiwe..
en-mt: All military bases in South Korea have been closed after testing found three soldiers with confirmed cases..

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: Amashejuli okundiza nawo athinteka futhi kanjalo ashintshwa. I-South Korea yethule okubhekwe njengohlelo olukhulu futhi oluhlelwe ngobugcweti emhlabeni lokuthi kubhekwe inani labantu ukuthi alinalo yini igciwane, bese kuhlukaniswa noma ubani othelelekile futhi kulandelelwe bese kuvalelwa labo abathintane nabo.
en-mt: Flight shelves are also affected and are thus replaced. South Korea has unveiled what is considered the world's largest and most comprehensive vaccination program to check the number of people for being infected, and isolate anyone suspected and tracked and quarantined those who come into contact with them.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: Izindlela zokubuka zihlanganisa ukuzibika wena okuphoqiwe lapho unezimpawu kulabo abavela emazweni angaphandle ngokusebenzisa ujlelo lukamakhal-ekhukhwini, ukuhlola igciwane ngokudlula ngemoto lapho imiphumela itholakala ngosuku olulandelayo, nokukhuphula ukukwazi ukuhlola okuzovumela abantu abangu-20,000 ukuthi bahlolwe usuku nosuku.
en-mt: Viewing methods include reporting yourself forced when you have symptoms for those from abroad through a mobile-phone visit, testing positive by car when results are available the next day, and increasing the ability to test which will allow 20,000 people to be tested daily.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: Uhlelo lwe-South Korea lubhekwa njengempumelelo programme ekulawuleni ubhubhane yize kungavalwa ngokuphelele amadolobha. Umphakathi wase-South Korea wawuhlukene ngombono ekuqaleni lapho Umongameli u-Moon Jae-in esabela kule nkinga.
en-mt: South Korea's program is considered a successful program in managing the pandemic even though cities can be completely closed. South Korea's interior was divided on the original view when President Moon Jae-in reacted to the crisis.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: Abantu abaningi baseKorea basayine izincwadi zesicelo sokuba kwenziwe uphenyo ngoMoon ngemva kwezinsolo zokuthi uhulumeni akazange asisingathe kahle isimo lapho kuqubuka igciwane, kanti abanye basayine izincwadi zokumncoma ngezinyathelo azithathile.
en-mt: Many Koreans have signed petitions for an investigation into Moon following allegations that the government did not handle the situation properly in the event of a virus outbreak, while others signed letters of recommendation for his steps.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-23 Mashi, kwabikwa ukuthi inani lababetheleleke ngaleli gciwane eSouth Korea lalehle ukwedlula zonke ezinye izinsuku amasontweni amane.
en-mt: On March 23, the number of people infected with the virus in South Korea was reported to have dropped above all other days in four weeks.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-29 Mashi, kwabikwa ukuthi kusukela ngomhla ka-1 Ephreli wonke umuntu owayefika evela kwelinye izwe wayezogcinwa endaweni ehlukanisiwe nabanye abantu ukuze lingasakazeni igciwane kuze kuphela amasonto amabili.
en-mt: On March 29, it was reported that from 1 April everyone arriving from another country would be quarantined in a quarantine facility to avoid spreading the virus for only two weeks.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: Ngokwemibiko yabezindaba eyakhishwa ngo-1 Ephreli, iSouth Korea yayithole izicelo ezivela emazweni angu-121 ukuba ilekelele ekuhloleni leli gciwane.
en-mt: According to media reports released on 1 April, South Korea had received requests from 121 countries to intervene in testing for the virus.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: Umbiko wokuqala wezibalo zababetholakale benegciwane le-SARS-CoV-2 e-Iran wakhishwa ngo-19 Febhuwari eQom, okuyilapho ngokombiko weMinistry of Health and Medical Education, kwashonela khona abantu ababili kamuva ngalolo suku.
en-mt: The first statistical report of those diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2 in Iran was released on February 19 in Qom, while according to a Ministry of Health and Medical Education report, two people died later that day.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: Izinyathelo zokuqala ezathathwa uhulumeni kwaba ukumiswa kwamakhonsathi neminye imikhosi yokugubha amasiko endawo, ezemidlalo nemithandazo eyenziwa njalo ngoLwesihlanu, ukuvalwa kwamanyuvesi nezikhungo zemfundo ephakeme kanye nezikole.
en-mt: The first steps taken by the government were the suspension of concerts and other celebrations to celebrate local customs, sports and prayers held every Friday, the closure of universities and higher education institutions and schools.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: I-Iran yakhipha imali engama-trillion ayisihlanu ama-rial ukuze ikwazi ukulwisana naleli gciwane.
en-mt: Iran released $5 trillion in rials to fight the virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-26 Febhuwari 2020, uMongameli uHassan Rouhani wathi zazingekho izinhleko zokuba izindawo okutholakale kuzo leli gciwane zigcinwe zivaliwe kodwa abantu kuphela ababezohlaliswa ezindaweni ezivikelekile ukuze bangalisakazi igciwane kwabanye.
en-mt: On 26 February 2020, President Hassan Rouhani said there were no plans for the places where the virus was found to be kept closed but that only people would be quarantined in protected areas so as not to spread the virus to others.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: Izinhlelo zokunciphisa ukuhamba kwabantu besuka kwamanye amadolobha beya kwamanye zamenyezelwa ngoMashi, nakuba isiminyaminya sezimoto saqhubeka sikhona ngenxa yokusondela kweholidi lokugujwa konyaka omusha iNowruz.
en-mt: Plans to limit the movement of people from one city to another were announced in March, although traffic jams continued to exist due to the imminent New Year's Eve holiday celebration of Nowruz.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: Amathempeli enkolo yobuShia aseQom aqhubeka evuliwe kwaze kwaba umhla ka-16 Mashi 2020. NgoFebhuwari I-Iran yaba iziko lokubhebhetheka kwaleli gciwane, ilandela iChina.
en-mt: The Shia temples of Qom remain open until March 16, 2020. In February Iran became the epicenter of the virus outbreak, following China.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: Izinsolo zokuthi i-Iran iye yanciphisa inani langempela labantu abanalesi sifo ukuze idlulisele isithombe okungesona zenza ukuba amazwe angaphezu kweshumi ayenabantu ababenalesi sifo aphenye ngomsuka waso. Athola ukuthi lesi sifo sase sikhona e-Iran ngoFebhuwari 28, usuku uhulumeni wase-Iran abika ngalo ukuthi babengu-388 kuphela abantu ababenaso, okungase kusho ukuthi inani lalingaphezulu kakhulu kunalokho okwabikwa.
en-mt: Reports that Iran has reduced the actual number of infected people to convey the wrong picture have led more than a dozen countries that had infected people to investigate their origins. They found that the disease was already present in Iran on Feb. 28, the day the Iranian government reported that there were only 388 cases, which may mean the number was much higher than reported.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-3 Mashi, iPhalamende lase-Iran lavalwa ngemva kokuthola ukuthi amalungu alo angu-23 kwangu-290 ayenaleli gciwane.
en-mt: On March 3, Iran's Parliament was shut down after finding that 23 of its 290 members had the virus.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-12 Mashi, iHuman Rights Watch yanxusa iziphathimandla zamajele ase-Iran ukuba zikhulule ngaphandle kwemibandela labo ababeboshwe bebhikisha ngokuthula belwela amalungelo abantu, nokuba kudedelwe okwesikhashana iziboshwa ezaziziphethe kahle.
en-mt: On March 12, Human Rights Watch urged Iranian prison authorities to release unconditionally those arrested for peacefully protesting for human rights, even temporarily releasing well-behaved prisoners.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: Le nhlangano yachaza ukuthi ayemaningi amathuba okusakazeka kwegciwane ezindaweni ezivalelekile, njengasemajele esikhashana angenazo nezinto ezanele zokwelapha.
en-mt: The charity explained that there were many opportunities for the spread of the virus in confined spaces, such as temporary prisons that did not have enough medical supplies.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: NgoMashi 15, uhulumeni wase-Iran wabika ukuthi babengu-100 abantu ababeshonile ngosuku olulodwa; okwakuyinani elaliphakeme ukuwedlula wonke kusukela leli gciwane lafika.
en-mt: On March 15, the Iranian government reported 100 people had died in one day; which was the highest number since the virus arrived.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: NgoMashi 17 kwase kushone osopolitiki base-Iran neziphathimandla zikahulumeni ezingaphezu kuka-12, okuhlanganisa labo ababesebenza esikhathini esingaphambili nalabo abebesasebenza khona namanje.
en-mt: On March 17 more than 12 Iranian politicians and government officials were killed, including those who worked in the past and those who still worked there.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: NgoMashi 23, base bengu-50 abantu ababethola leli gciwane ngehora kanti njalo ngemva kwemizuzu eyishumi kwakufa umuntu oyedwa ngenxa yegciwane le-corona.
en-mt: On March 23, there were 50 people who contracted the virus per hour and every ten minutes one person died from the coronavirus.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: Othile osebenzela inhlangano i-WHO, wathi kungenzeka ukuthi amanani angempela ase-Iran aphindwe kasihlanu kunalawo abikwayo.
en-mt: Someone who works for who, said it was possible that Iran's actual numbers were five times higher than those reported.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: Waphinde wathi kungenzeka ukuthi izindleko iMelika ezikhokhisa i-Iran zinomthelela endleleni leli zwe elingakwazi ukusingatha ngayo le nkinga ngokwezimali.
en-mt: He also said it was possible that u.S. costs to Iran affect the way the country could handle the crisis financially.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: I-UN High Commissioner for Human Rights ikhiphe isiqondiso sokuthi kuncishiswe izindleko ezikhokhiswa amazwe alimale kakhulu kwezomnotho ngenxa yaleli gciwane elihlasele emhlabeni wonke, okubalwa kuwo ne-Iran.
en-mt: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has issued an directive to reduce the costs charged to countries that have been severely economically damaged by the virus that has hit the world, including Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: NgoJanuwari 31, kwaqinisekiswa ukuthi leli gciwane lase lisakazeke laze lafika nase-Italy ngesikhathi izivakashi ezazivela eChina zitholakala zinegciwane iSARS-CoV-2 eRome.
en-mt: On January 31, it was confirmed that the virus had spread to Italy while tourists from China were diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: Amanani abanaleli gciwane anyuka ngokushesha, okwaholela ekutheni uhulumeni wase-Italy amise wonke amabhanoyi ayeya eChina nalawo ayebuya khona, wabe esekhipha isimemezelo sokuthi izwe lilonke lase lingaphansi kwesimo esibucayi.
en-mt: Infection rates rose rapidly, leading the Italian government to suspend all planes to and from China, and issued a declaration that the country as a whole was under a critical condition.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: Kamuva endaweni ehlukile kwatholakala elinye iqembu labantu abangu-16 ababenesifo se-COVID-19, imibiko ngabo yaqala ukutholakala ngoFebhuwari 21 eLombardy. NgoFebhuwari 22, i-Council of Ministers yakhipha isimemezelo esingokomthetho sezinyathelo zokuvimba ukuba leli gciwane lingasakazeki, esasihlanganisa nokuhlukaniswa emphakathini kwabantu abangaphezu kuka-50 000 abanaleli gciwane emadolobheni angu-11 asezindaweni ezisenyakatho ye-Italy.
en-mt: Later at a different location another group of 16 people were diagnosed with COVID-19, reports of which were first detected on Feb. 21 in Leopardy. On Feb. 22, the Council of Ministers issued a legal declaration of measures to prevent the spread of the virus, which included social isolation of more than 50,000 infected people in 11 cities in northern Italy.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: UPrime Minister uGiuseppe Conte wathi, "Ngeke kube namuntu ovunyelwa ukungena noma ukuphuma kulezi zindawo ezinamanani amakhulu egciwane.
en-mt: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "No one will be allowed in or out of these areas with high infection rates.

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: Sekumiswe yonke imisebenzi kanye nezemidlalo kulezi zindawo." NgoMashi 4, uhulumeni wase-Italy wamemezela ukuvalwa kwazo zonke izikole namanyuvesi kulo lonke elase-Italy ngemva kokuba inani lababulawe yileli gciwane lifinyelele u-100.
en-mt: All activities and sports in these areas have been suspended." On March 4, the Italian government announced the closure of all schools and universities across Italy after the death toll from the virus reached 100.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: Yonke imidlalo emikhulu, kuhlanganise nemidlalo yeSerie A, yayizoqhubeka kodwa ngaphandle kwezihlwele kuze kube inyanga ka-Ephreli, kodwa ngomhla ka-9 Mashi yavele yamiswa ngokuphelele yonke imidlalo isikhathi esingangenyanga.
en-mt: All majors, including Serie A matches, would continue but without crowds until April, but on 9 March all matches were completely suspended for a month.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: NgoMashi 11, uPrime Minister uConte wakhipha isiqondiso sokuba kumiswe cishe zonke ezamabhizinisi ngaphandle kwezitolo zokudla nalezo ezidayisa imithi yokwelapha. Ngomhla ka-6 Mashi ikolishi lase-Italy okuthiwa i-Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (i-SIAARTI) lakhulula imithetho yokuziphatha kwezisebenzi zezokwelapha eyayizosiza ekuqondiseni izindlela ezazingasetshenziswa lapho kucwaningwa ngalesi sifo.
en-mt: On March 11, Prime Minister Conte issued an order to suspend almost all businesses except grocery stores and those selling prescription drugs. On 6 March the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) loosened the code of conduct for medical staff that would help direct methods that could not be used when investigating the disease.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: NgoMashi 19, ngemva kokukhipha inani labantu abangu-3,405 ababebulawe yisifo secorona, i-Italy yadlula iChina okwakuyiyona eyayinamanani edlula wonke amanye amazwe emhlabeni.
en-mt: On March 19, after releasing a total of 3,405 coronavirus deaths, Italy surpassed China which had the highest numbers in the world.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: NgoMashi 22, kwabikwa ukuthi i-Russia yayithumele amabhanoyi ezempi ayisishiyagalolunye ukuba ahambise izinto zokwelapha e-Italy.
en-mt: On March 22, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military aircraft to deliver medical supplies to Italy.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: Kusukela ngomhla ka-5 Ephreli, e-Italy kwase kunabantu abangu-128 948 abanesifo secorona, bengu-15 887 asebebulawe yiso nabangu- 21 815 ababeluleme kuso. Iningi lala manani lalivela endaweni yaseLombardy.
en-mt: As of 5 April, there had been 128,948 coronavirus cases in Italy, 15,887 deaths from it and 21,815 cases. Most of these figures came from the Leopardy area.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: Umbiko we-CNN ubonise ukuthi kungenzeka ukuthi imbangela yokwenyuka kwenani labantu ababulawa yileli gciwane e-Italy inani eliphakeme labantu abakhulile ngeminyaka nokuntuleka kwezindlela zokuhlolwa kwalabo abanaleli gciwane.
en-mt: A CNN report has shown that the likely cause of the rise in the number of people dying from the virus in Italy is the high number of older people and the lack of screening methods for those infected.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: Indlela izwe lase-UK elisabele ngayo lapho kuvela lesi sifo okokuqala ibonise ukungasukumeli phezulu uma iqhathaniswa nakwamanye amazwe athintekile, futhi kwaze kwaba umhla ka-18 Mashi 2020, uhulumeni waseBrithani ungazenzile izinhlelo zokuba abantu banciphise amazinga okusondelana noma zokuba labo abanegciwane bahlukaniswe emphakathini ukuze isifo singasakazeki.
en-mt: The UK's initial reactability to the outbreak showed a lack of rise compared to other affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not make plans for people to reduce social distancing rates or for those infected to be socially isolated to prevent the spread of the disease.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: Ngenxa yalokho, abantu bawugxekile uhulumeni ngokungayithatheli phezulu le ndaba nangendlela osabele ngayo lapho umphakathi uzwakalisa ukukhathazeka. NgoMashi 16, uPrime Minister uBoris Johnson wenza isimemezelo ngokuphathelene nokuhamba ngokungadingekile nokuthintana kwabantu, wanxusa ukuba abantu basebenzele emakhaya uma kungenzeka futhi bagweme izindawo ezinjengezindawo zokuphuza, ezokudla nezemidlalo yasemashashalazini namabhayisikobho.
en-mt: As a result, people have criticized the government for not taking the issue seriously and how it responded when the public expressed concern. On March 16, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement regarding unnecessary travel and social contact, urging people to work from home if possible and avoid places such as drinking, food and theatres and cinemas.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: NgoMashi 20, uhulumeni wamemezela ukuthi izindawo zikaqedisizungu ezinjengezindawo zokuphuza nezokujima zazizovalwa ngokushesha, wathembisa ukukhokhela izisebenzi ingxenye yomholo engaba ngu-80% kodwa engeke ibe ngaphezu kuka-2 500 ngenyanga ukuze kugwenywe ukulahleka kwemisebenzi ngale nkathi. NgoMashi 23, uPrime Minister wamemezela ukuthi kwakuzobekwa imithetho eqinile ngokuphathelene nokusondelana kwabantu, wavala ngokuphelele ukuhlangana kwabantu abangaphezu kwababili, wanciphisa izinga lokuhamba kwabantu nokuba ngaphandle ngokungadingekile.
en-mt: On March 20, the government announced that gyms such as drinking and running venues would be closed immediately, promising to pay workers a portion of wages of about 80% but no more than 2,500 per month to avoid job losses during this period. On March 23, the Prime Minister announced that stricter rules would be put in place regarding social distancing, completely banned gatherings of more than two people, reduced the rate of movement of people and even unnecessarily outdoors.

sourceString: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
targetString: Ngokungafani nezinyathelo zangaphambili, kulokhu kwabekwa amaphoyisa ayezoqikelela ukuthi abantu bayazilandela iziqondiso futhi ehlawulisa labo abangazilaleli, ayehlakaza namaqembu.
en-mt: Unlike previous measures, in this case police were set up who would assume that people were following the guidelines and fined those who did not obey them, and dispersed them with groups.

sourceString: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.
targetString: Amabhizinisi amaningi athola isiqondiso sokuba avalwe, ngaphandle kwalawo ayesebenza ngezinto "eziyisidingo" njengezitolo ezidayisa ukudla, izitolo ezidayisa imithi yokwelapha, amabhange, izitolo ezidayisa amathuluzi, amagaraji kaphethiloli nalawo akhanda izimoto.
en-mt: Many businesses received guidance to close, except those that operated on "essential" items such as grocery stores, pharmacies, banks, tool shops, petrol garages and car manufacturers.

sourceString: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.
targetString: NgoJanuwari 20, kwakhishwa umbiko wokuqala wesifo se-COVID-19 endaweni esePacific Northwest eWashington, esasitholakale kowesilisa owayekade ebuye ngoJanuwari 15 evela eWuhan.
en-mt: On January 20, the first report of the COVID-19 disease was released at a location in the Pacific Northwest in Washington, which had been found in a man who had previously returned on January 15 from Wuhan.

sourceString: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
targetString: NgoJanuwari 29, kwamiswa ithimba okuthiwa iWhite House Coronavirus Task Force.
en-mt: On January 29, a team called the White House Coronavirus Task Force was set up.

sourceString: On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
targetString: NgoJanuwari 31, ihhovisi likaTrump lamemezela isimo esiphuthumayo kwezokwelapha zomphakathi, labe selibeka imingcele eyayizolawula ukungena kwabantu abavela eChina.
en-mt: On January 31, Trump's office declared a state of emergency for public health, setting limits that would control the entry of people from China.

sourceString: On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
targetString: NgoJanuwari 28 2020, isikhungo sikahulumeni waseMelika esihamba phambili kwezokwelapha, i-Center for Disease Control, sakhipha isimemezelo sokuthi sase sizenzele ithuluzi lokuhlola leli gciwane.
en-mt: On January 28 2020, the u.S. government's leading medical center, the Center for Disease Control, issued an announcement that it had made a self-testing tool for the virus.

sourceString: Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
targetString: Naphezu kwalezi zinyathelo, iMelika yephuza ukuqalisa izinhlelo zokuhlola ukuthi babebangaki abase benalo leli gciwane okwenza langasheshe lacaca izinga lesi sifo esase sisakazeke ngalo.
en-mt: Despite these measures, the U.S. was unable to launch programs to test how many had contracted the virus, making it soon clear the extent of the spread of the disease.

sourceString: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).
targetString: Ukuhlola izinga lokusakazeka kwalesi sifo kwaphazanyiswa nawungabi namathuluzi okuhlola asebenza kahle njengoba lawo ayethunyelwe ihhovisi likahulumeni ngoFebhuwari ayefile, ukungayitholi imvume kahulumeni yokusebenzisa amathuluzi okuhlola ayevela ezinhlanganweni ezizimele (njengezikhungo zokucwaninga nezemfundo, izinkampani nezibhedlela) kwaze kwaphela inyanga kaFebhuwari kanye nayimibandela yokuhlolwa kwabantu kwaze kwaba sekuqaleni kukaMashi (ngemva kwalokho kwakudingeka incwadi kadokotela).
en-mt: Testing the rate of spread of the disease was interrupted by the lack of effective testing tools as those sent to the government office in February were dead, not getting government approval to use test kits from independent agencies (such as research and education institutions, companies and hospitals) until the end of February and the terms of the testing until early March (after which a doctor's letter was required) .

sourceString: By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
targetString: NgoFebhuwari 27, iphephandaba i-The Washington Post, labika ukuthi babengaphansana kuka-4 000 abantu abase behlolelwe leli gciwane eMelika.
en-mt: On Feb. 27, The Washington Post, reported that there were less than 4,000 people who had tested positive for the virus in the United States.

sourceString: By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-13 Mashi, iphephandaba i-The Atlantic labika ukuthi babengaphansi kuka-14 000 abantu abase behlolelwe leli gciwane.
en-mt: On March 13, The Atlantic reported that fewer than 14,000 people had tested positive for the virus.

sourceString: On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-22 Mashi iphephandaba i-Associated Press labika: "Abantu abaningi ababonisa izimpawu nabanezincwadi zikadokotela balinde amahora abanye izinsuku ukuze bahlolwe." Ngemva kombiko wokufa komuntu wokuqala eWashington ngoFebhuwari 29, uGovernor uJay Inslee wamemezela isimo esiphuthumayo, isinyathelo esalandelwa nakwezinye izingxenye zaseMelika.
en-mt: On March 22 the Associated Press reported: "Many people who show symptoms and have doctor's prescriptions wait hours for some days to be checked." Following a report of the first person's death in Washington on Feb. 29, Governor Jay Census declared a state of emergency, a move followed by other parts of the United States.

sourceString: Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.
targetString: NgoMashi 3, izikole ezisendaweni yaseSeattle zavalwa, kwathi maphakathi noMashi nezinye izikole ezweni lonke zaqala ukuvala. NgoMashi 6, 2020 iqembu elicwaninga ngezifo nendlela ezisakazeka ngayo lase-Imperial College London, laxwayisa izwe laseMelika ngezinga leli gciwane elisha le-corona alalisazosabalala ngalo.
en-mt: On March 3, schools in the Seattle area were closed, and in mid-March and other schools across the country began to close. On March 6, 2020 imperial College London's disease and transmission research team, warned the United States of the extent to which the new coronavirus would no longer spread.

sourceString: On the same day President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.
targetString: Ngalolo suku, uMongameli uTrump wasayina isivumelwano somthetho esibizwa ngokuthi iCoronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, esasizokhipha imali engamadola angu-8.3 billion eyayizosiza izikhungu zikahulumeni ekubhekaneni nezindleko eziphuthumayo sokulwisana nalesi sifo.
en-mt: That day, President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which would release $8.3 billion that would help government agencies deal with the urgent costs of fighting the disease.

sourceString: Corporations imposed employee travel restrictions, cancelled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.
targetString: Izinkampani zabekela izisebenzi zazo imingcele ngokuphathelene nokuhamba, zamisa imihlangano emikhulu ebihleliwe, zakhuthaza izisebenzi ukuba zisebenzele emakhaya.
en-mt: Companies set limits on their employees regarding travel, suspended scheduled large gatherings, encouraged workers to work from home.

sourceString: Sports events and seasons were cancelled.On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective 13 March.
targetString: Izinhlelo zemidlalo emikhulu zamiswa. NgoMashi 11, uTrump wakhipha isimemezelo sokuthi ukuya emazweni amaningi aseYurophu kwakuzomiswa izinsuku ezingu-30 kusukela noMashi 13, ngaphandle kokuya e-UK.
en-mt: Major sports programs were suspended. On March 11, Trump issued an announcement that travel to most European countries would be suspended for 30 days from March 13, except for travel to the UK.

sourceString: The following day, he expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.
targetString: Ngosuku olulandelayo waqinisa le mingcele ngokuyifaka i-UK ne-Ireland ohlwini lwamazwe okwakungeke kusayiwa kuwo.
en-mt: The next day he tightened these borders by putting the UK and Ireland on a list of countries that would not be moved to.

sourceString: On 13 March, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.
targetString: NgoMashi 13, wamemezela isimo esiphuthumayo okwaholela ekukhululweni kwezimali zikahulumeni ezazizosiza ekubhekaneni nalesi simo esibucayi.
en-mt: On March 13, he declared a state of emergency that led to the release of government funds that would help address this critical situation.

sourceString: Beginning on 15 March, many businesses closed or reduced hours throughout the U.S. to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: Kusukela ngoMashi 15, amabhizinisi amaningi avalwa amanye anciphisa amahora okusebenza kulo lonke elaseMelika ukuze kunqandwe ukusakazeka kwegciwane.
en-mt: Since March 15, many businesses have closed some reduced working hours across the United States to prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.
targetString: NgoMashi 17, lesi sifo sase sibikwe kuzo zonke izingxenye ezingu-50 zezwe laseMelika kuhlanganise naseColumbia. NgoMashi 23, kwabikwsa ukuthi idolobha laseNew York lalinabantu abangu-10 700 abanegciwane le-corona, okuyinani elingaphezu kwenani labanegciwane sebebonke eSouth Korea.
en-mt: By March 17, the disease had been reported in all 50 parts of the United States including Columbia. On March 23, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 coronavirus cases, more than the total number of viruses in South Korea.

sourceString: On 25 March, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as estimates of case doubling slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.
targetString: NgoMashi 25, undunankulu wathi ukugwema ukusondelana kwabantu kwakubonakala kusebenza, ngoba ukulinganisa kokuphindeka kabili kwezibonelo kuye kwanensa ekusukeni ezinsukwini ezingu-2.0 kuye ezinsukwini ezingu-4.7.
en-mt: On March 25, the prime minister said avoiding social distancing seemed to work, because the doubling of examples has slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.

sourceString: As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.
targetString: Kusukela ngoMashi 28, base bengu-32,308 abantu abanegciwane edolobheni laseNew York, bengu-672 abase bebulawe yileli gciwane. NgoMashi 26, kwabikwa ukuthi inani labanesifo se-corona eMelika lase liwedlula amanani akwamanye amazwe emhlabeni wonke, okuhlanganisa iChina ne-Italy. Kusukela ngo-Ephreli 8, sekubikwe izibonelo ezingu-400,335 e-United States, kanti sekufe abangu-12,841.
en-mt: As of March 28, there have been 32,308 cases in New York City, 672 of which have died from the virus. On March 26, it was reported that the number of coronavirus cases in the United States had exceeded the numbers of foreign countries around the world, including China and Italy. As of April 8, 400,335 examples have been reported in the United States, and 12,841 have died.

sourceString: Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
targetString: Ngombiko okhishwe abezindaba ngomhla ka-30 Mashi, uMongameli waseMelika uTrump unqume ukunweba isikhathi ebesibekiwe ukuze kusiqinisekiswe ukungasondelani kwabantu kuze kube u-Ephreli 30.
en-mt: In a report released to the media on March 30, U.S. President Trump decided to extend the deadline to ensure social distancing until April 30.

sourceString: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
targetString: Ngololo suku, umkhumbi oyisibhedlela onemibhede engaba ngu-1 000, i-USNS Comfort, wafika eNew York.
en-mt: That day, a hospital ship with about 1,000 beds, the USNS Comfort, arrived in New York.

sourceString: On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
targetString: Ngo-Ephreli 3, i-U.S. ibe nesibalo esingu-884 sabafile ngenxa ye-coronavirus enkathini yamahora angu-24.
en-mt: On April 3, the U.S. had 884 coronavirus-related deaths over a 24-hour period.

sourceString: In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.
targetString: E-New York, inani labantu abanegciwane lase ledlulile ku-100 000 ngo-Ephreli 3. IPhalamende iWhite House igxekiwe ngokulithatha kancane leli gciwane nangokuthonya imibiko ekhishwa abezomnyango wezempilo nososayensi ngokukhipha isiqondiso sokuba iziphathimandla zezempilo zibambisane noSekela-Mongameli uMike Pence ekukhipheni imibiko eya emphakathini ngokuphathelene naleli gciwane.
en-mt: In New York, the number of people infected had already surpassed 100,000 by April 3. The White House has been criticized for taking the virus lightly and influencing reports issued by health departments and scientists by issuing a directive for health officials to cooperate with Vice President Mike Pence in releasing public reports about the virus.

sourceString: Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
targetString: Ukwamukelwa kwethimba elimiswe uTrump ukuba lihole kulesi simo esibucayi kubonakala kunokuchema futhi kusekelwa abalandeli beqembu lakhe.
en-mt: The acceptance of the team that Trump has set up to lead in this critical situation seems rather than mourning and being supported by fans of his party.

sourceString: Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.
targetString: Ezinye iziphathimandla zaseMelika nabezindaba ziyigxekile iMelika ngokuncika kakhulu kwezohwebo nezwe laseChina ukuze ithole izinto eziyisidingo ezihlanganisa nezinto ezidingekayo kwezokwelapha.
en-mt: Some U.S. and media officials have criticized the U.S. for relying heavily on trade with China to obtain essentials that include medical supplies.

sourceString: An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
targetString: Ucwaningo lenqubo yokuhamba komoya lasebenziswa ukuze kuhlelwe futhi kuqagelwe inqubo yokusakazeka lase lunyatheliswa nge-The Journal of Travel Medicine maphakathi noJanuwari 2020.
en-mt: The air travel process study was used to plan and predict the spread process and was published by The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.

sourceString: Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
targetString: Ngokwalokho okwakukhishwe ngo-2018 yiqembu le-International Air Transport Association, iBangakok, iHong Kong, iTokyo neTapei kwakungamazwe anezivakashi eziningi ezivela eWuhan.
en-mt: According to what was released in 2018 by the International Air Transport Association,Bangakok, Hong Kong, Tokyo and Tapei were the countries with the most visitors from Wuhan.

sourceString: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
targetString: IDubai, iSydney neMelborne nawo ayizindawo ezithandwa kakhulu abantu abavela eWuhan.
en-mt: Dubai, Sydney and Melborne are also the most popular destinations for people from Wuhan.

sourceString: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.
targetString: Phakathi kwezindawo ezingu-20 ezithandwa kakhulu yizivakashi zakwamanye amazwe, kwabikwa ukuthi iBali yayingakulungele kunazo zonke ukubhekana naleli gciwane, amadolobha ase-Australia ayehamba phambili phakathi kwezindawo ezikulungele kangcono. I-Australia yakhipha izinhlelo zayo zokubhekana naleli gciwane embikweni wayo i-Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus(COVID-19) ngoFebhuwari 7.
en-mt: Among the 20 most popular destinations for foreign tourists, it was reported that Bali was the most unprepared to deal with the virus, with Australian cities leading among the best prepared areas. Australia released its plans to deal with the virus in its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus(COVID-19) on Feb. 7.

sourceString: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
targetString: Yabonisa ukuthi kwakukuningi okwakungakaziwa nge-COVID-19, nokuthi enye yezindlela zokubhekana nalesi sifo kwakuwukuqinisa ekuqapheni imingcele yezwe nangokungagodli lutho okumelwe kwaziswe abantu.
en-mt: It showed that there was a lot that was not yet known about COVID-19, and that one of the ways to deal with the disease was to strengthen border guarding and not restricting what people should know.

sourceString: On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
targetString: NgoMashi 21, i-Australia yakhipha isimemezelo esiphuthumayo sesifo esibulalayo.
en-mt: On March 21, Australia issued an emergency declaration of a deadly disease.

sourceString: Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
targetString: Ngemva kokusebenza kwesinyathelo sokuvalwa kwezinto zokuthutha umphakathi eWuhan naseHubei, amazwe amaningi ahlele ukukhipha izakhamuzi zawo nabameleli bamazwe abo kulezi zindawo esebenzisa izindiza eziqashiwe zasemazweni awo ngemvume yeziphathimandla zaseChina.
en-mt: Following the implementation of the ban on public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, many countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and representatives of their countries from these areas using chartered domestic aircraft with the permission of Chinese authorities.

sourceString: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
targetString: Amazwe okuqala alanda izisebenzi zawo kwakuyiCanada, iMelika, iJapan, i-India, iSri Lanka, i-Australia, iFrance, i-Argentina, iGermany neThailand.
en-mt: The first countries to recruit their workers were Canada, America, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany and Thailand.

sourceString: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
targetString: IPakistan ithe ngeke ibuyise muntu oseChina.
en-mt: Pakistan said it would not return anyone in China.

sourceString: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
targetString: NgoFebhuwari 7, iBrazil yathutha ngokushesha amalungu omndeni waseBrazil angu-34, ngaphezu kwalabo abane basePoland, oyedwa waseChina nomunye wase-India.
en-mt: On Feb. 7, Brazil quickly transported 34 Brazilian family members, more than four Polish, one Chinese and one Indian.

sourceString: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
targetString: Lezi zakhamuzi zasePoland, eChina nase-India zazehle ePoland okuyilapho le ndiza yaseBrazil ayayizoma khona isikhashana ngaphambi kokuqhubeka nomzila wayo oya eBrazil.
en-mt: The Polish, Chinese and Indian citizens landed in Poland where the Brazilian plane will stop for a while before continuing its route to Brazil.

sourceString: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
targetString: Izakhamuzi zaseBrazil ezazikade ziseWuhan zazihlaliswe endaweni yamasosha eseduze kwaseBrasilia njengesinyathelo sokuvimbela ukusabalala kwegciwane.
en-mt: Brazilians who were once in Wuhan were stationed at a military base near Brasilia as a measure to prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Ngalolo suku kwalandwa izakhamuzi zaseCanada ezingu-215 eWuhan (ezingu-176 zazisendizeni yokuqala, ezingu-39 zisendizeni yesibili eyayiqashwe uhulumeni waseMelika) zayiswa e-CFB Trenton ukuze zihlale lapho amasonto amabili ukuze kuvinjwe ukusabalala kwegciwane.
en-mt: On that day 215 Canadians were picked up from Wuhan (176 were on the first flight, 39 on the second flight hired by the U.S. government) were taken to CFB Trenton to stay there for two weeks to prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
targetString: Ngo-11 February, elinye ibhanoyi elinabantu abangu-185 base-Canada elivela e-Wuhan lafika e-CFB Trenton.
en-mt: On 11 February, another plane with 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.

sourceString: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
targetString: Amagunya ase-Australia athutha amalungu omphakathi angu-277 ngo-3 no-4 February bayiswa e-Christmas Island Detention Centre, ebilungiswe kabusha ukuze ibe indawo yokuvalelwa, bahlala khona izinsuku ezingu-14.
en-mt: Australian authorities transported 277 members of the public on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been renovated to become a detention centre, staying there for 14 days.

sourceString: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.
targetString: Indiza yokuthuthwa yase-New Zealand yafika e-Auckland ngo-5 February; abagibeli bayo (kuhlanganisa abathile base-Australia nabase-Pacific) babevalelwe endaweni yemikhumbi yempi e-Whangaparoa, enyakatho ye-Auckland.
en-mt: The New Zealand transport plane arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some Australians and Pacificers) were detained at a military naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.

sourceString: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
targetString: Ngo-15 February, i-United States yamemezela ukuthi izothutha abantu base-America ababegibele umkhumbi wokuhamba i-Diamond Princess.
en-mt: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would transport Americans on board the Diamond Princess cruise ship.

sourceString: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
targetString: Ngo-21 February, ibhanoyi elithwele abagibeli base-Canada abangu-129 ababethuthwe begibele i-Diamond Princess lafika e-Trenton, e-Ontario.
en-mt: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers transported aboard the Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.

sourceString: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
targetString: Ekuqaleni kuka-March, uhulumeni wase-India waqala ukuthutha izakhamuzi zawo zivela e-Iran. Ngo-14 March indiza ye-South African Airways eqashwe Uhulumeni wase-South Africa yabuyisela ezweni izakhamuzi zase-South Africa ezingu-112.
en-mt: In early March, the Indian government began transporting its citizens from Iran. On 14 March a South African Airways plane chartered by the South African Government returned to the country 112 South African citizens.

sourceString: Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
targetString: Ukubheka kwezokwelapha bekwenziwa ngaphambi kokuhamba, futhi abane base-South Africa ababebonisa izimpawu ze-coronavirus bashiwa ngemuva ukuze kuncishiswe ingozi.
en-mt: Medical check-ups were being carried out before departure, and four South Africans who were showing coronavirus symptoms were left behind to reduce the risk.

sourceString: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
targetString: Izakhamuzi zase-South Africa ezinemiphumela yokuhlola elandulayo kuphela ezabuyiselwa ezweni.
en-mt: South Africans with the following test results were only returned to the country.

sourceString: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.
targetString: Imiphumela yokuhlola yakhulula bonke abase-South Africa, kuhlanganise abasebenzi bendiza, abashayeli bendiza, izisebenzi zasehhotela, amaphoyisa namasosha ayehlangenyele kulomsebenzi wokusiza abantu okwathi, njengesinyathelo sokuqapha, banke bahlala ngaphansi kokuqashwa nokuvalelwa inkathi yezinsuku ezingu-14 e-The Ranch Resort.
en-mt: The test results freed all South Africans, including flight attendants, flight attendants, hotel staff, police and soldiers who had been involved in the humanitarian operation which, as a precaution measure, the bank remained under recruitment and detention for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.

sourceString: On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
targetString: Ngo-20 March, i-United States yaqala ukukhipha kancane amabutho ayo e-Iraq ngenxa yobhubhane.
en-mt: On 20 March, the United States began partially withdrawing its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.

sourceString: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
targetString: Ngo-5 February, umnyango wezangaphandle wase-China wabika ukuthi amazwe angu-21 (okuhlanganisa i-Belarus, i-Pakistan, i-Trinidad and Tobago, i-Egypt, ne-Iran) athumele usizo e-China.
en-mt: On 5 February, China's foreign ministry reported that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.

sourceString: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.
targetString: Abanye abafundi base-China abakumanyuvesi ase-America bahlangana ndawonye ukuze basize bathumele usizo kulezo zindawo zase-China ezihlaselwe igciwane, beneqembu elikhulu lendawo ebanzi yase-Chicago babika ukwazi ukuthumela amamaski angu-50,000 e-N95 ezibhedlela ezisesifundeni sase-Hubei ngo-30 January. Inhlangano yokusizwa kwabantu i-Direct Relief, isebenzelana ne-FedEx, yathumela amamaski obuso angu-200,000 kanye nezinye izinto zokuvila umuntu siqu, okuhlanganisa amagilavu nezingubo, ngokundizisa kwesimo esiphuthumayo okuya e-Wuhan Union Hospital ngo-30 January.
en-mt: Some Chinese students at American universities gathered together to help send aid to those virus-hit areas of China, with a large group of chicago-wide areas reporting being able to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in Hubei province on 30 January. The charity Direct Relief, in partnership with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks and other personal laziness items, including gloves and clothing, in an emergency declaration to Wuhan Union Hospital on 30 January.

sourceString: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".
targetString: Ngo-5 February, u-Bill no-Melinda Gates bamemezela umnikelo wezigidi ezingu-$100 ku-WHO ukuze uxhase ukucwaningela ikhambi nemisebenzi yokulapha kanjalo nokuvikela "inani labantu abasengozini e-Africa nase-South Asia".
en-mt: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to WHO to support drug research and treatment activities as well as to protect "the number of vulnerable people in Africa and South Asia".

sourceString: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.
targetString: I-Interaksyon yabika ukuthi uhulumeni wase-China yanikela ngamamaski angu-200,000 kubantu base-Philippines ngo-6 February, ngemuva kokuthi u-Senator Richard Gordon ethumele amamaski ayizigidi ezingu-3.16 e-Wuhan.
en-mt: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to Filipinos on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon sent 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.

sourceString: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
targetString: Ngo-19 February, i-Singapore Red Cross yamemezela ukuthi izothumela usizo lwezigidi ezingu-$2.26 e-China.
en-mt: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced it would send $2.26 million in aid to China.

sourceString: Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.
targetString: I-Japan inikele ngamamaski ayisigidi esisodwa e-Wuhan, i-Turkey yahambisa izinto zezokwelapha, i-Russia yathumela e-Wuhan amathani angaphezulu kwezigidi ezingu-13 ezinto zezokwelapha, i-Malaysia imemezele umnikelo wamaglavu ezokwelapha ayizigidi ezingu-18 e-China, i-Germany ihambise izinhlobo ezihlukene zezinto zezokwelapha kuhlanganise u-10,000 wama-Hazmat suits, ne-United States inikele amathani angu-17.8 tons ezinto zezokwelapha e-China futhi yathembisa izigidi ezingu-$100 ngokwengeziwe wokusekela ngokwezimali kumazwe athintekile. Ngemuva kokubonakala kwezibonelo zase-China zibohla, izwe belithumela usizo emazweni ahlukene athintwe ubhubhane.
en-mt: Japan donated one million masks to Wuhan, Turkey delivered medical supplies, Russia sent to Wuhan more than 13 million tons of medical supplies, Malaysia has announced an offer of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany has delivered a variety of medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States has donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and pledged $100 million more  financial support to affected countries. After the appearance of China's examples declining, the country was sending aid to different countries affected by the pandemic.

sourceString: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Ngo-March, i-China, i-Cuba ne-Russia yathumela izimpahla zezokwelapha futhi ilindele ukusiza i-Italy ibhekane nokuqubuka kwe-coronavirus yayo.
en-mt: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and expect to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.

sourceString: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.
targetString: Usomabhizinisi u-Jack Ma wathumela izigidi ezingu-1.1 zamakhithi okuhlola, amamaski obuso ayizigidi ezingu-6, namasudi okuvikela angu-60,000 e-Addis Ababa, e-Ethiopia ukuze zabiwe yi-African Union.
en-mt: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million test kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.

sourceString: He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
targetString: Waphinda kamuva wathumela amakhithi okuhlola angu-5,000, amamaski obuso angu-100,000 kanye nama-ventilators angu-5 e-Panama.
en-mt: He also later sent 5,000 test kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.

sourceString: Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.
targetString: U-Ma uphinde wanikela ngezimpahla zezokwelapha e-Canada. I-The Netherlands, i-Spain, i-Turkey, i-Georgia, ne-Czech Republic baveze ukukhathazeka ngamamaski enziwe e-China namakhithi okuhlola.
en-mt: Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada. The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic have expressed concern about masks made in China and test kits.

sourceString: For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.
targetString: Ngokwesibonelo, i-Spain yakhipha amakhithi okuhlola enziwe e-China angu-58,000 anokunemba okungaba u-30% nje, ngesikhathi esifanayo, i-Netherlands yabizela emuva amamaski obuso ase-China angu-600,000 atholakala enenkinga defective.
en-mt: For example, Spain issued 58,000 China-made test kits with just about 30% accuracy, at the same time, the Netherlands called back 600,000 China face masks found to have a defective problem.

sourceString: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
targetString: I-Belgium yabizela emuva amamaski angasebenziseki angu-100,000, acabangelwa njengavele e-China, kanti eqinisweni ayevela e-Colombia.
en-mt: Belgium called back 100,000 unusable masks, imported as imports from China, and were in fact from Colombia.

sourceString: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.
targetString: Ngakolunye uhlangothi, usizo lwase-China lwamukelwe ngezandla ezivulekile kwezinye izindawo zase-Latin America nase-Africa. Ngo-2 April, i-World Bank yaqalisa imisebenzi yokusekela isimo esiphuthumayo samazwe asathuthuka.
en-mt: On the other hand, China's aid has been welcomed with open hands in other parts of Latin America and Africa. On 2 April, the World Bank launched operations to support the state of emergency for developing countries.

sourceString: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
targetString: I-WHO income imizamo yamagunya ase-China yokunakekela nokuvalela umshayabhuqe.
en-mt: WHO income efforts by China's authorities to care for and contain the scourge.

sourceString: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".
targetString: I-WHO iqaphele umahluko phakathi kokuqubuka kuka-2002–2004 kwe-SARS, lapho amagunya ase-China amangalelwa ngokwenza ngasese okwabangela ubunzima ekuvikeleni futhi kwalulaza imizamo yokuvalela, kanye nesimo samanje lapho uhulumeni oyinhloko "ehlinzekele njalo ngizibuyekezo ukuze kugwenywe uvalo ngaphambi kwamaholidi e-Lunar New Year".
en-mt: WHO noted the difference between the 2002–2004 outbreak of SARS, in which Chinese authorities were accused of secretly performing acts that caused difficulty in protecting and undermined lockdown efforts, and the current situation in which the central government "provided constant updates to avoid lockdown ahead of the Lunar New Year holidays".

sourceString: On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.
targetString: Ngo 23 January, isabela ekunqumeni kwamagunya ayinhloko ukuthi kumiswe umthetho ovala ezokuthutha e-Wuhan, omelela i-WHO u-Gauden Galea waphawula ukuthi noma lokhu "kungesiso neze isikhuthazo se-WHO", ngesikhathi esifanayo "isinqumo esibaluleke kakhulu sokuzinikela ekuvaleleni umshayabhuqe endaweni lapho ugxile kakhulu khona" futhi wasibiza ngokuthi "esingakaze sibe khona ngaphambili emlandweni wezezempilo zomphakathi". Ngo-30 January, kulandela ukuqiniseka kokudluliselana komuntu nomuntu ngaphandle kwase-China nokuphakama kwesibalo sezibonelo kwamanye amazwe, i-WHO yamemezela ukuqubuka ngokuthi i-Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), i-PHEIC yesithupha kusukela isinyathelo saqala ukuncengelwa ngokuqubuka kuka-2009 kwe-swine flu.
en-mt: On 23 January, reacting to the decision by the central authorities to enact a ban on transport in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea noted that while this is "by no means a who's recommendation", at the same time "a very important decision to commit to banning the scourge in a place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in the history of public health". On 30 January, following the certainty of human-to-human transmission outside China and the rise in the number of cases in other countries, WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), PHEIC's sixth since the initiative was first requested by the 2009 outbreak of swine flu.

sourceString: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.
targetString: Umqondisi Omkhulu we-WHO u-Tedros Adhanom uthe i-PHEIC ibe ngenxa yesizathu "sengozi yokusabalala kwembulunga, ikakhulukazi emazweni ezimali eziphansi nezimali eziphakathi angenayo inqubo yezezempilo enamandla.
en-mt: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said PHEIC has been responsible for "the risk of global spread, especially in low-income and middle-income countries that do not have a strong health system.

sourceString: In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."
targetString: Esabela ekumisweni kwemikhawulo yokuhamba, u-Tedros ukhiphe elokuthi "asikho isizathu sezinyathelo ezithinta ukuhamba nokuhwebelana kwamazwe ngaphandle kwesidingo" nokuthi "i-WHO ayikukhuthazi ukubeka umkhawulo kwezokuhweba nokunyakaza."
en-mt: Reacting to the suspension of travel restrictions, Tedros issued that "there is no reason for measures affecting international travel and trade without need" and that "WHO does not recommend imposing trade and movement restrictions."

sourceString: On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".
targetString: Ngo-5 February, i-WHO yanxusa izigidi engu-$675 kumphakathi wembulunga ukuze kuxhaswe isu lokulindelela lamazwe ezimali eziphansi, ilandisa ngokuphuthuma kokusekela lawo mazwe "angenazo izindlela ezikhona zokuthola abantu abathole igciwane, noma kungathiwa liyavela".
en-mt: On 5 February, WHO appealed $675 million to the global community to support a plan for low-income countries, increasing the urgency of supporting those countries that "do not have existing ways to detect people who have contracted the virus, or may be said to be emerging".

sourceString: Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.
targetString: U-Tedros waqhubeka nokulandisa ephakamisa ukuthi "siqine kuphela ngezinga lalowo othambe kakhulu wethu" futhi wancenga umphakathi wamazwe onke ukuthi "utshale imali namhlanje noma uhlawule kakhulu ngokuzayo". Ngo-11 February, i-WHO phakathi nengqungquthela yabezindaba yamisa i-COVID-19 yaba igama lesifo.
en-mt: Tedros went on to relate suggesting that "we are only strong at the level of the one who is our softest" and pleaded with the international community to "invest today or pay more in the future". On 11 February, who during a press conference stopped COVID-19 became the name of the disease.

sourceString: On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".
targetString: Ngosuku olufanayo, u-Tedros washo ukuthi uNobhala Jikelele we-UN u-António Guterres ubesevumile ukuhlinzekela "amandla enqubo yonke ye-UN ekusabeleni".
en-mt: On the same day, Tedros said that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide "the strength of the entire UN process in response".

sourceString: A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".
targetString: Iqembu Lokunakekela Inhlekelele le-UN liqalisiwe njengomphumela, kwavumela ukubambisana kokusabela kwayo yonke i-United Nations, okwenza i-WHO ithi lokhu kuzovumela yona ukuthi "igxile ekusabeleni kwezezempilo lapho abanye abamelelayo beletha okwabo ubuhlakani ekubambeni ububanzi kwezokuhlala, kwezomnotho nezokuthuthukisa okuvezwa ukuqubuka".
en-mt: The UN Disaster Care Group was launched as a result, allowing for a collaborative response of the entire United Nations, which the WHO says will allow it to "focus on health responses where other representatives bring their own intelligence to capture the breadth of the social, economic and development exposure to outbreaks".

sourceString: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".
targetString: Ngo 14 February, iqembu eliholwa i-WHO leNjongo Ehlangene ne-China laqaliswa ukuze lihlinzekele ochwepheshe bomhlaba ne-WHO endaweni ephansi e-China ukuze basize ekunakekelene ngaphakathi bese besinga isimo "sobukhulu nokudluliseleka kwegciwane" ngokuvula imihlangano yokufundisana hosting workshops nemihlangano nezikhungo zezinga lezwe elimqoka nokuqhuba uhlelo lokuvakashela amagceke ukuze kuhlolwe "umphumela wemisebenzi yokusabela ngezinga lezifunda nezifundazwe, kuhlanganise izimo zasemadolobheni nezasemaphandleni". Ngo-25 February, i-WHO yamisa ukuthi "izwe kumele lenze okwengeziwe ukuzilungiselela okungase kube ubhubhane lwe-coronavirus," ibika ukuthi yize kusekuqaleni kakhulu ukuyibiza ngobhubhane, amazwe kumele kodwa abe "sesigabeni sokulindela".
en-mt: On 14 February, the WHO-led Group for the Joint Purpose of China was launched to provide ground and WHO experts at a low level in China to help care for each other internally and address the status of "magnitude and transmission of the virus" by opening training meetings hosting workshops and meetings with key national level institutions and conducting a series of field visits to assess the "effect of response activities at the regional and provincial level, including conditions  urban and rural". On 25 February, WHO set out that "the country must do more to prepare for what could be a coronavirus pandemic," reporting that while it is too early to call it a pandemic, countries must but be "in the waiting phase".

sourceString: In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, the WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation.On 28 February, WHO officials said that the coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", its highest level of alert and risk assessment.
targetString: Isabela ekwandeni kokuqubuka e-Iran, i-WHO ithumele Eqembu Elihlangene Lomgomo khona ukuze lihlaziye isimo. Ngo-28 February, i-WHO ikhiphe elokuthi ukuhlaziya ingozi ye-coronavirus ezingeni lomhlaba kuzophakamiswa kusuke "kokuphakeme" kuye "kokuphakeme kakhulu", okuyibanga eliphakeme kakhulu lesixwayiso nokuhlaziya ingozi.
en-mt: Reacting to the increase in outbreaks in Iran, WHO has sent to the United Nations Policy Group there to review the situation. On 28 February, WHO issued a statement that the update on the risk of coronavirus at the ground level will be raised from "high" to "very high", which is the highest level of warning and risk analysis.

sourceString: Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.
targetString: U-Mike Ryan, ongumqondisi ophethe wohlelo lezokuphuthumayo kwezempilo ze-WHO, uxwayisile ngamazwi athi "Lokhu kuyinkathi yokusanguluka kuwo wonke uhulumeni emhlabeni: Vukani.
en-mt: Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned with the words "This is a time of emergency for every government in the world: Wake up.

sourceString: This virus may be on its way and you need to be ready," urging that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst of it".
