targetString: Leli gciwane kungenzeka lisendleleni yayo futhi kudingeka ukulindela," ukuncenga ukuthi izinyathelo zokusabela okuhle kungasiza umhlaba ugweme "okubi kakhulu kwalo".
en-mt: The virus may be on its way and needs to be expected," pleading that positive reaction measures can help the world avoid its "worst".

sourceString: Ryan further stated that the current data did not warrant public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean "we're essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to that virus."
targetString: U-Ryan uphinde wathi idatha yamanje ayizange ibizele ukuthi izisebenzi zezempilo zomphakathi zimemezele ubhubhane wezwe lonke, ethi ukukhipha isimemezelo esinjalo kungasho ukuthi "samukela ukuthi wonke umuntu emhlabeni uzochayeka kulelo gciwane."
en-mt: Ryan also said the current data did not call for public health workers to declare a nationwide pandemic, saying issuing such an announcement would mean "we accept that everyone in the world will recover from that virus."

sourceString: On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
targetString: Ngo-11 March, i-WHO yamemezela ukuqubuka kwe-coronavirus ubhubhane.
en-mt: On 11 March, WHO announced the outbreak of the coronavirus pandemic.

sourceString: The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.
targetString: Umqondisi Jikelele uthe i-WHO "ikhathazeke kakhulu ngakho kokubili ukuthusa kwamazinga okubhebhetheka nobunzima, kanye namazinga athusayo okungenzi lutho". I-WHO ibhekane nokugxekwa ngokubonakala kungukuphatha okungagculisi kobhubhane, kuhlanganise ukwephuza kokumemezela isimo esiphuthumayo sezempilo yomphakathi nokuqoka igciwane njengobhubhane.
en-mt: The Director General said the WHO was "deeply concerned about both the shock rates of swings and difficulties, and the alarming levels of inaction". WHO has faced criticism for appearing to be an insatiable handling of the pandemic, including drinking to declare a public health emergency and identifying the virus as a pandemic.

sourceString: The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
targetString: Imbibizane ihlanganise isicelo somphakathi sokuthi Umqondisi Jikelele we-WHO u-Tedros Adhanom afake incwadi yakhe yokushiya umsebenzi, yasayinwa ngabantu abangu-733,000 ngo-6 April.
en-mt: The petition included a public petition for WHO Director General Tedros Adhanom to file his resignation, signed by 733,000 people on 6 April.

sourceString: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
targetString: Ngo-26 March 2020, inqwaba yochwepheshe be-UN bamalungelo abantu bagcizelela ukuhlonishwa kwamalungelo abo bonke abantu njengoba kuqhubeka ubhubhane lwe-COVID-19.
en-mt: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts stressed respect for the rights of all people as the COVID-19 pandemic continues.

sourceString: The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
targetString: Iqembu lochwepheshe laphakamisa ukuthi wonke umuntu unelungelo kukho konke ukungenela kokusindisa impilo nokuthi uhulumeni unomthwalo wemfanelo kulokhu.
en-mt: The expert group suggested that everyone has the right to all lifesaving interventions and that the government is responsible for this.

sourceString: The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.
targetString: Iqembu lagcizelela ukuthi ukuntulela kwamandla noma kwemishwalense yezezempilo akumele neze kusebenze njengesizathu sokubandlulula iqembu elithile.
en-mt: The group stressed that a lack of capacity or health insurance should never serve as a reason to discriminate against a particular group.

sourceString: The experts underscored that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.
targetString: Ochwepheshe bagxile ekutheni wonke umuntu unelungelo lokufinyelela ezezempilo, okuhlanganisa abantu abakhubazekile, abavela kumaqembu amancane, abantu abakhulile, abantu abangababaleli bangaphakathi, abangenamakhaya, labo abaphila ngaphansi kwezimo zobumpofu obunzima, abantu ababoshiwe, kanjalo abangababaleki namanye amaqembu angacacisiwe adinga usizo lukahulumeni.
en-mt: Experts focus on why everyone has access to health care, which includes people with disabilities, from minority groups, older people, people who are internal intermediaries, homeless, those living under severe poverty conditions, people who are incarcerated, as well as those who are not refugees and other unspecified groups that need government assistance.

sourceString: International governmental organizations are addressing the economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis.
targetString: Izinhlangano zohulumeni bamazwe zinakekela imiphumela yezomnotho nezokuhlala zenhlekelele ye-COVID-19.
en-mt: National government agencies are taking care of the economic and social consequences of the COVID-19 crisis.

sourceString: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform to provide timely and comprehensive information on policy responses in countries around the world, as well as viewpoints and advice.
targetString: I-The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development iqalise ilungiselelo lokuhlinzekela ngolwazi olufika ngesikhathi noluphelele endleli yokusabela emthethweni ngamazwe emhlabeni jikelele, kanjalo nemibono nezeluleko.
en-mt: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched an arrangement to provide timely and complete information on the international legal response level around the world, as well as visions and advice.

sourceString: From policies to strengthen health systems and the world economy to addressing the effects of lockdown and restrictions on travel, the digital hub includes a Country Policy Tracker, and aims to help countries learn from each other and to facilitate a co-ordinated global response to the coronavirus challenge.
targetString: Kusukela emithethweni yokuqinisa inqubo yezezempilo nezomnotho zomhlaba kuye ekunakekeleni imiphumela yokuvala phansi nokukhawula ukuhamba, ihabhu yedijithali ihlanganisa i-Country Policy Tracker, futhi ihlose ukusiza amazwe afunde kwelinye nelinye nokungenela ekuvumelaniseni ukusabela kwembulunga kulenselele ye-coronavirus.
en-mt: From laws to strengthen the world's health and economic process to managing the effects of lockdowns and travel restrictions, the digital hub integrates the Country Policy Tracker, and aims to help countries learn from each other and step in to align the global response to the coronavirus challenge.

sourceString: The Chinese government has been criticized by the United States, UK Minister for the Cabinet Office Michael Gove, and Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro's son Eduardo Bolsonaro for its handling of the pandemic, which began in the Chinese province of Hubei.
targetString: Uhulumeni wase-China ugxekwe kakhulu yi-United States, i-UK Minister ye-Cabinet Office u-Michael Gove, no-Eduardo Bolsonaro indodana kaMongameli wase-Brazil u-Jair Bolsonaro ngendlela abaphathe ngayo ubhubhane, olwaqala e-Hubei eyizifundazwe sase-China.
en-mt: The Chinese government has been heavily criticized by the United States, UK Cabinet Office Minister Michael Gove, and Eduardo Bolsonaro the son of Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro for his handling of the pandemic, which began in China's provinces of Hubei.

sourceString: A number of provincial-level administrators of the Communist Party of China (CPC) were dismissed over their handling of the quarantine efforts in Central China, a sign of discontent with the political establishment's response to the outbreak in those regions.
targetString: Isibalo sabasingathi bezinga lesifundazwe be-Communist Party of China (CPC) baxoshwa ngesizathu sendlela abaphatha ngayo imizamo yokuvalelwa e-Central China, uphawu lokunganeliseki endleleni yokusabela kwegatsha lepolitiki ekuqubukeni kulezo zindawo.
en-mt: A number of provincial level holders of the Communist Party of China (CPC) were expelled for the way they handled detention efforts in Central China, a sign of dissatisfaction on the way to the political branch's reaction to the outbreak in those areas.

sourceString: Some commentators believe that this move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from the public's anger over the coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Abanye abahlaziyi bakholelwa ukuthi lesi sinyathelo besihloselwe ukuvikela unobhala jikelele we-Chinese Communist Party u-Xi Jinping olakeni lomphakathi endabeni yokuqubuka kwe-coronavirus.
en-mt: Some analysts believe the move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from public confusion in the context of the coronavirus outbreak.

sourceString: Some Chinese officials, e.g. Zhao Lijian rejected an earlier acknowledgement of the coronavirus outbreak starting in Wuhan, in favour of conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 originating from the U.S. or Italy.
targetString: Abanye abasebenzi base-China, isib. u-Zhao Lijian wala ekuqaleni ukwamukela ukuqubuka kwe-coronavirus okuqala e-Wuhan, ekhetha imibono yozungu mayelana ne-COVID-19 njengeqhamuka e-U.S. noma e-Italy.
en-mt: Some Chinese workers, e.g. Zhao Lijian initially refused to accept the first coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan, preferring the world's views on COVID-19 as originating in the U.S. or in Italy.

sourceString: The U.S. administration of Donald Trump has referred to the coronavirus as "Chinese virus" or "Wuhan virus" saying that China's "censorship supercharged a virus that has now turned into a global pandemic", which has in turn been criticized by some critics as racism and "distract[ing] from his administration's failure to contain the disease".
targetString: I-U.S. administration ka-Donald Trump ike yabiza i-coronavirus ngokuthi "i-Chinese virus" nokuthi "i-Wuhan virus" bethi inqubo ye-China "yokwenza ngokufihla kuphe amandla igciwane manje eseliphenduke ubhubhane lomhlaba", okuphenduke kwagxekwa ngabanye abagxeki njengokucwasa "nokuphazam[isa] ekuhlulekeni kwe-administration yakhe yokuvalela isifo".
en-mt: Donald Trump's U.S. administration has called the coronavirus a "Chinese virus" and that the "Wuhan virus" say China's "secretly acting process has empowered a virus that has now turned into a global pandemic", which has turned out to be criticized by some critics as a "distraction[isa] in the failure of his pandemic lockdown administration".

sourceString: The Daily Beast obtained a U.S. government cable outlining a communications stratagem with apparent origins in the National Security Council, with the strategy being quoted as "Everything is about China.
targetString: I-The Daily Beast yafinyelela ukwaziswa kwahulimeni we-U.S. eveza kabanzi isu lokukhulumisana okusobala ukuthi kuvela ku-National Security Council, isu licashunwe ngokuthi "Yonke into imayelana ne-China.
en-mt: The Daily Beast reached out to u.S. detailing the strategy of transparent communication that comes from the National Security Council, the strategy is quoted as "Everything is about China.

sourceString: We're being told to try and get this messaging out in any way possible, including press conferences and television appearances."Outlets such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg have claimed that China's efforts to send aid to virus-stricken countries is part of a propaganda push for global influence.
targetString: Siyatshelwa ukuthi sizame ukukhipha lomyalezo nganoma iyindlela engenzeka, kuhlanganise izingqungquthela zabezindaba nokuvela kuma-TV. "Abasakazi abanjenge-Politico, i-Foreign Policy, ne-Bloomberg balandise ukuthi imizamo ye-China yokuthumela usizo emazweni ahlaselwe igciwane kuyingxenye yenkulumo-ze lokufinyelela ukwazi ukuthonya imbulunga.
en-mt: We are told to try to remove this message in any possible way, including press conferences and TV appearances. "Broadcasters such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg have reported that China's efforts to send aid to virus-hit countries are part of a talk-about approach to being able to influence the planet.

sourceString: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell warned that there is "a geo-political component including a struggle for influence through spinning and the 'politics of generosity'".
targetString: Isikhulu senqubomgomo yangaphandle se-EU u-Josep Borrell waxwayisa ukuthi kukhona "inhlansi yepolitiki yendawo ehlanganisa umshikashika wokuba nethonya ngokusonta izinto ne-'politiki yokuba nesandla esivulekile'".
en-mt: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell warned that there is a "local political spark that combines a tendency to influence by spinning things and the 'politics of having an open hand'".

sourceString: Borrell also said that "China is aggressively pushing the message that, unlike the US, it is a responsible and reliable partner."
targetString: U-Borrell uphinde wathi "i-China iphusha ngamandla umlayezo wokuthi, ngokungafani ne-US, yona ingumlingani onesibopho nothembekile."
en-mt: Borrell also said that "China strongly misses the message that, unlike the US, it is a responsible and reliable partner."

sourceString: China has also called for the US to lift its sanctions off of Syria, Venezuela and Iran, while reportedly sending aid to the latter two countries.
targetString: I-China iphinde yakhulumela ukuthi i-US iphakamise umnswinyo wayo e-Syria, e-Venezuela nase-Iran, yize kubikwa ukuthi ithumela usizo kulamazwe amabili okugcina.
en-mt: China has also spoken out that the US has raised its whip in Syria, Venezuela and Iran, despite reportedly sending aid to the last two countries.

sourceString: Jack Ma's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by US sanctions on 3 April.
targetString: Umnikelo ka-Jack Ma wamamaski angu-100,000 aya e-Cuba wavinjwa unswinyo lwase-US ngo-3 April.
en-mt: Jack Ma's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by a US vaccine on 3 April.

sourceString: US authorities have also been accused of diverting aid meant for other nations to their own country.
targetString: Amagunya ase-US aphinde amangalelwa ngokuphambukisa usizo olumiselwe ezinye izizwe ukuthi luye ezweni awo.
en-mt: US authorities have also been accused of diverting aid set up by other nations to go to their country.

sourceString: And there have been mask-related disputes reported between other countries, such as Germany, Austria and Switzerland; and the Czech Republic and Italy.
targetString: Futhi kube nemibiko yokubangwa kwamamaski phakathi kwamanye amazwe, anjengeJalimane, i-Austria ne-Switzerland, kanye ne-Czech Republic ne-Italy.
en-mt: There have also been reports of mask claims among other countries, such as Germany, Austria and Switzerland, as well as the Czech Republic and Italy.

sourceString: In addition, Turkey seized hundreds of ventilators destined for Spain.
targetString: Ngaphezu kwalokho, i-Turkey yaqhwaga amakhulu ama-ventilator abelibangise e-Spain.
en-mt: Additionally, Turkey cracked hundreds of ventilators it had built in Spain.

sourceString: In early March, the Italian government criticized the European Union's lack of solidarity with coronavirus-affected Italy.
targetString: Ekuqaleni kuka-Mashi, uhulumeni wase-Italy ugxeke i-European Union ngokuntula ubunye ne-Italy ibe ihlaselwe i-coronavirus.
en-mt: In early March, the Italian government criticised the European Union for lacking unity with Italy and had been hit by the coronavirus.

sourceString: Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU, said that "Only China responded bilaterally.
targetString: uMaurizio Massari, inxusa le-Italy kwi-EU, uthe "i-China kuphela esabele ngokuthe nqgo.
en-mt: Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU, said "only China has responded steadily.

sourceString: Certainly, this is not a good sign of European solidarity."
targetString: Ngokuqinisekile, lolu akulona uphawu oluhle ngobunye be-Europe"
en-mt: Certainly, this is not a good sign for European unity"

sourceString: On 22 March, after a phone call with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian president Vladimir Putin arranged the Russian army to send military medics, special disinfection vehicles, and other medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: Ngomhlaka 22 Mashi, ngemva kokuxhumana ngocingo nondunankulu wase-Italy, umongameli wase-Russia uVladimir Putin wahlela ukuba ibutho lase-Russia lithumele i-Italy abezokwelapha basempini, izinqola ezikhethekile zokubulala amagciwane neminye imishini yezokwelapha.
en-mt: On 22 March, after a telephone contact with the Italian prime minister, Russian president Vladimir Putin arranged for the Russian military to send to Italy military medical staff, special disinfection wagons and other medical equipment.

sourceString: Italy's La Stampa newspaper cited an anonymous "high-level political source" that 80 percent of Russia's aid was "useless or of little use to Italy".
targetString: Iphephandaba lase-Italy i-La Stampa lacaphuna ngomthombo "osezingeni eliphezulu kwezobusazwe" ukuthi ingxenye engu 80% yosizo lwase-Russia "lwalu ngesizo lwalutho noma kwawusizo oluncane kwi-Italy"
en-mt: Italian newspaper La Stampa quoted a "high-level political" source as saying that 80% of Russian aid "was for nothing or was of little benefit to Italy"

sourceString: The source accused Russia of embarking on a "geopolitical and diplomatic" charm offensive.
targetString: Lomthombo wasola elase-Russia ngokuqhuba umkhankaso wokuzenza ithandeke " ngokwezepolitiki "
en-mt: The source accused Russia of running a campaign to make themselves "politically motivated "

sourceString: The President of Lombardy, Attilio Fontana, and Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio dismissed the media reports and expressed their gratitude.
targetString: Umongameli wase-Lombardy, uAttilio Fontana, noNgqongqoshe weZangaphandle e-Italy uLiuigi Di Maio bayichithile imibiko yabezindaba bazwakalisa ukwazisa kwabo.
en-mt: Lombardy's president, Attilio Fontana, and Italian Foreign Minister Liuigi Di Maio have dismissed media reports expressing their awareness.

sourceString: Russia also sent a cargo plane with medical aid to the United States.
targetString: i-Russia yaphinde yathumela e-United States indiza ethwala impahla kuphela inosizo lwezinto zokwelapha
en-mt: Russia also sent to the United States a cargo plane only with medical assistance

sourceString: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that "when offering assistance to US colleagues, [Putin] assumes that when US manufacturers of medical equipment and materials gain momentum, they will also be able to reciprocate if necessary."
targetString: Usomlomo we-Kremlin u-Dmitry Peskov uthe "uma simukelisa usizo kubalingani bethu base-US, [uPutin] uhlawumbisela ukuthi abakhiqizi base-US abakha into zezokwelapha bazokwazi ukusenzela okufanayo uma kudingeka"
en-mt: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said "if we accept help from our US counterparts, [Putin] suggests that US manufacturers who build medical supplies will be able to do the same for us if needed"

sourceString: The planned NATO "Defender 2020" military exercise in Germany, Poland, and the Baltic states, the largest NATO war exercise since the end of the Cold War, will be held on a reduced scale.
targetString: Izivivinyo zempi ezihleliwe ze-Nato "Defender 2020" eJalimane, Poland, nasezizweni zeBaltic, okuyizivivinyo zempi ezinkulu kunazo zonke zeNato kusukela kwaphela iCold War, zizokwenziwa ngezinga elincishisiwe.
en-mt: Scheduled Nato "Defender 2020" military tests in Germany, Poland, and the Baltic states, which are Nato's largest military tests since the end of the Cold War, will be conducted at a reduced rate.

sourceString: The Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament's general secretary Kate Hudson criticized the Defender 2020 exercise: "In the current public-health crisis, it jeopardizes the lives not only of the troops from the US and the many European countries participating but the inhabitants of the countries in which they are operating."The Iranian government has been heavily affected by the virus, with around two dozen parliament members infected as well as fifteen other current or former political figures.
targetString: Unobhala Jikelele we-The Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament uKate Hudson ulugxekile uvivinyo iDefender 2020: "Phakathi nosizi lwezempilo emphakathini, kubekwa engozini hhayi kuphela izimpilo zamasosha avela eUS namanye amazwe aseEurope ahlanganyelayo kodwa kanye nezakhamuzi zamazwe lapho esebenzela khona. "Uhulumeni waseIran ucindezelwe kakhulu yile-virus, njengoba kunamalungu ephalamende angase abe amashumi amabili nane asethelelekile kanye nabangamashumi nanhlanu osopolitiki bamanje noma abakudala.
en-mt: Secretary General of The Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament Kate Hudson criticised the December 2020 test: "Amid the public health crisis, the health of not only troops from the US and other European member states but also the citizens of the countries where they serve is threatened. " Iran's government has been overwhelmed by the virus, as there are perhaps twenty-four mPs and 15 current or former politicians.

sourceString: Iran's President Hassan Rouhani wrote a public letter to world leaders asking for help on 14 March 2020, saying that his country is struggling to fight the outbreak due to lack of access to international markets as a result of the United States sanctions against Iran.The outbreak has prompted calls for the United States to adopt social policies common in other wealthy countries, including universal health care, universal child care, paid family leave, and higher levels of funding for public health.
targetString: Umongameli waseIran uHassan Rouhani ubhalale abaholi bamazwe incwadi ecela usizo ngo 14 Mashi 2020, izwe lakhe lidonsa kanzima nokulwa naloluqubuko ngenxa yokungakwazi ukufinyelela izimakethe zomhlaba okubangelwa iminswinyo yeUnited States ngokumelene nelaseIran. Lomqubuko uholele ukuthi kwenziwe izincomo zokuthi iUnited States yamukele imigomo yezenhlalo ecabangelayo njengezinye izizwe ezinothile, ukunakekelwa kwezidingo zempilo zawonke wonke, ukunakekelwa kwezidingo zezingane, ukuthathwa kwekhefu lomndeni okukhokhelwe umqashi kanye nokuxhaswa okusezingeni eliphakeme kwezezokwelapha umphakathi.
en-mt: Iran's President Hassan Rouhani has written a letter to world leaders asking for help on 14 March 2020, his country struggling to fight the outbreak due to inability to access land markets caused by U.S. sanctions against Iran. This outbreak has led to recommendations for the United States to adopt thoughtful social policies such as certain ethnic groups, universal health care, child care, employer-paid family leave and high public health support.

sourceString: Political analysts anticipated it may negatively affect Donald Trump's chances of re-election in the 2020 presidential election.Diplomatic relations between Japan and South Korea worsened due to the pandemic.
targetString: Abahlaziyi bezombusazwe balindele ukuthi kungase kuwathinte ngokungekuhle amathuba aDonald Trump okuphinde aphumelele okhethweni lobumongameli luka 2020. Ubuhlobo bezombusazwe phakathi kweJapani neSouth Korea buye ngokuba bubi ngenxa yalolubhubhane.
en-mt: Political analysts expect it could negatively affect Donald Trump's chances of winning the 2020 presidential election. Political relations between Japan and South Korea have been damaged by the pandemic.

sourceString: South Korea criticized Japan's "ambiguous and passive quarantine efforts" after Japan announced anybody coming from South Korea will be placed in two weeks' quarantine at government-designated sites.
targetString: iSouth Korea igxeke iJapani "ngemizamo-mbumbulu yokuvalelwa kwabantu" ngemva kokuthi elaseJapani limemezele ukuthi noma ubani ovela eSouth Korea uzogcinwa amasonto amabili evalelwe ezikhungweni ezikhethwe uhulumeni
en-mt: South Korea has criticised Japan for "bullet-shelled detention efforts" after Japan announced that anyone from South Korea would be held for two weeks in detention at government-designated facilities

sourceString: The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: Ngasekuqaleni, umphakathi waseSouth Korea ubuhlukene kakhulu ngemibono mayelana nokusabela kukamongameli uMoon Jae-in kulolusizi.
en-mt: Initially, South Korean society was deeply divided on views on president Moon Jae-in's reaction to the tragedy.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.The pandemic has allowed countries to pass emergency legislation in response.
targetString: AmaKorean amaningi asayine izicelo zokumgudluza esikhundleni uMoon noma ezikuncomayo ukusabela wakhe. Lolubhubhane luvumele amazwe ukuthi asabele ngokuthi aphasise imithetho yezezinhlekelele.
en-mt: Many Koreans have signed petitions to replace Moon or praise his reaction. The pandemic has allowed countries to respond by adopting disaster laws.

sourceString: Some commentators have expressed concerns that it could allow governments to strengthen their grip on power.
targetString: Abanye abaphawuli bazwakalise ukukhathazeka ngokuthi ingavumela ohulumeni baqinise izintambo abambe ngazo amandla okubusa.
en-mt: Some commenters have expressed concern that it could allow governments to tighten their grip on power.

sourceString: In Hungary, its parliament voted to allow the prime minister, Viktor Orbán, to rule by decree indefinitely, suspend parliament as well as elections and punish those deemed to have spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis.
targetString: EHungary, iphalamende lakhona livotele ukuvumela undunankulu uViktor Orban ukubusa okungaphelelwa isikhathi, ekwazi ukumisa ukusebenza kwephalamende nokhetho nokuthi ajezise labo okuthiwa basakaza kwaziswa kungamanga ngale-virus nendlela uhulumeni alusingathe ngayo.
en-mt: In Hungary, its parliament voted to allow Prime Minister Viktor Orban to rule in time, being able to suspend parliamentary functioning and elections and to punish those allegedly spreading misinformation about the virus and how the government handled it.

sourceString: The coronavirus outbreak has been blamed for several instances of supply shortages, stemming from globally increased usage of equipment to fight the outbreaks, panic buying, and disruption to factory and logistic operations.
targetString: Kusolwe ukuqubuka kwecoronavirus ngokushoda kwezinto ezithile ngenxa yokwanda kokusetshenziswa kwemishini kuliwa nalomqubuko, ukuthenga ngokutatazela kanye nokuphazamiseka ezindawei zokukhiqiza nakwezokuthutha impahla.
en-mt: The coronavirus outbreak has been blamed on shortages due to increased equipment use fighting the outbreak, hesitant shopping and disruptions in manufacturing and freight.

sourceString: The United States Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about shortages of drugs and medical equipment due to increased consumer demand and supplier disruption.
targetString: iUnited States Food and Drug Administration ikhiphe izixwayiso ngokushoda kwezidakamizwa ezisemthethweni nemshini yezokwelapha ngenxa yokuphakama kwenani elifunwa abathengi nokuphazamiseka kubathengisi.
en-mt: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about the shortage of legal drugs and medical equipment due to rising consumer demand and disruption to retailers.

sourceString: Several localities also witnessed panic buying that led to shelves being cleared of grocery essentials such as food, toilet paper, and bottled water, inducing supply shortages.
targetString: Izindawana ezimbalwa zibone ukuthenga ngamawala kwezinto okuholele ekushesheni kokuphela kwempahla eyisisekelo njengokudla, itoilet paper namanzi athengwayo okubangele ukushoda kwezinto ezidingekayo
en-mt: A few communities have seen the purchase of raw materials that have led to the rapid depletion of basic goods such as food, toilet paper and purchased water causing shortages of essentials

sourceString: The technology industry in particular has been warning about delays to shipments of electronic goods.
targetString: Imboni yezobuchwepheshe ibilokhu ixwayisa ngokubambezeleka kokuthuthwa kwezimpahla ezisebenza ngogesi.
en-mt: The technology industry has been warning of delays in the transportation of electrically operated goods.

sourceString: According to WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom, the demand for personal protection equipment has risen 100-fold.
targetString: NgokukaMqondisi Jikelele weWHO uTedros Adhanom, ukufuneka kwezinto zokuvikela umuntu siqu kuye kwanda ngenani eliphindwe ngo-100.
en-mt: According to WHO Director General Tedros Adhanom, the need for personal protective equipment has increased by 100 times.

sourceString: This demand has led to the increase in prices of up to twenty times the normal price and also induced delays on the supply of medical items for four to six months.
targetString: Lokhu kufuneka kwezinto kuye kwaholela ekukhuleni kwamanani ngezinga elize libe ngenani elingamashumi amabili inani elivamile lokuthenga futhi kuye kwadaleka ukubambezeleka kwezinto zezokwelapha ngezinyanga ezine kuye kweziyisithupha
en-mt: This demand has led to inflation at a rate of up to 20 times the normal purchase price and has caused delays in medical supplies by four to six months

sourceString: It has also caused a shortage of personal protective equipment worldwide, with the WHO warning that this will endanger health workers.
targetString: Kuphinde kwadala ukuntuleka kwezinto zokuvikela umuntu siqu emhlabeni wonke ize neWho ixwayise ngokuthi lokhu kubeka engozini izipilo zabasebenzi bezokwelapha.
en-mt: It has also created a lack of personal protective equipment around the world and who has warned that this threatens the health of medical staff.

sourceString: In Australia, the pandemic provided a new opportunity for daigou shoppers to sell Australian products into China.
targetString: eAustralia, lolubhubhane ludale ithuba elisha kubathengi be-daigou lokukuba badayisele imikhiqizo yaseAustralia eChina
en-mt: in Australia, the pandemic has created a new opportunity for daigou buyers to sell Australian products in China

sourceString: The activity has created a shortage of baby formula in some supermarkets and was subsequently banned by the Australian government.Despite the high prevalence of COVID-19 cases in Northern Italy and the Wuhan region, and the ensuing high demand for food products, both areas have been spared from acute food shortages.
targetString: Ukwenzeka kwalokhu kuyekwadala ukuntuleka ngokudla kwebhodlela kwezingane kwezinye izitolo ezinkulu uhulumeni waseAustralia wase eyakuvala. Naphezu kwezinga eliphakeme lesifo iCovid-19 eNyakatho neItaly nasesifundeni saseWuhan nokufuneka okukhulu kokudla okulandelile, zombili lezizindawo azibanga nokuntuleka kokudla okukhulu.
en-mt: The incident also creates a shortage of baby bottle food in some supermarkets that the Australian government has already closed. Despite the high rate of Covid-19 in Northern Italy and the Wuhan region and the high demand for food that followed, both regions have not had severe food shortages.

sourceString: Measures by China and Italy against the hoarding and illicit trade of critical products have been successful, avoiding acute food shortages that were anticipated in Europe as well as in North America.
targetString: Izinyathelo zeChina neItaly ngokumelene nokuqongelelwa nanokushushumbiswa kwezinto ezibaluleke kakhulu zibe yimpumelelo nokuvimbe ukusweleka kokudla obekulindelwe eEurope naseNyakatho Melika
en-mt: China and Italy's measures against the accumulation and burning of critical supplies have been successful and prevented food shortages expected in Europe and North America

sourceString: Northern Italy with its significant agricultural production has not seen a large reduction, but prices may increase according to industry representatives.
targetString: Inyakatho neItaly kanye nenala yezolimo zayo ayibonanga ukuncipha okukhulu, kodwa ngokwalabo abamelele imboni, amanani angase anyuke.
en-mt: Northern Italy and much of its agriculture have not seen a significant decline, but for those representing the industry, prices may rise.

sourceString: Empty food shelves were only encountered temporarily, even in Wuhan city, while Chinese government officials released pork reserves to assure sufficient nourishment of the population.
targetString: Ukungabikho luthu emashalofini okudla kwaba okwesikhashana ngisho nasedolobheni lase Wuhan, kanti eChina, izisebenzi zikahulumeni zidedele inyama yengulube ebiqongelelwe ukuze kuqikelelwe ukondleka kwezakhamuzi.
en-mt: The lack of one on the food shelves was temporary even in the city of Wuhan, while in China, civil servants have neglected pork collected to estimate the nutrition of citizens.

sourceString: Similar laws exist in Italy requiring food producers to keep reserves for such emergencies.
targetString: Imithetho efanayo ikhona nakwelaseItaly edinga labo abahlinzeka ngokudla ukuthi baqongelelele izikhathi eziphuthumayo.
en-mt: Similar laws exist in Italy that require those who provide food to collect emergencies.

sourceString: Damage to the global economy has been felt in China: according to a media report on 16 March, the economy in China was very hard hit in the first two months of 2020 due to the measures taken by the government to curtail virus spread, and retail sales plunged 20.5%.
targetString: Ukulimala komnotho womhlaba kuzwakalile eChina, ngokwemibiko yabezindaba ngo-16 Mashi 2020, umnotho waseChina washayeka kakhulu ezinyangeni zokuqala ezimbili zika 2020 ngenxa yezinyathelo ezathathwa uhulumeni ukuze kunqandwe ukubhebhetheka kwale-virus, okuthengwa ezitolo ziwohloke ngo-20.5%
en-mt: The damage to the earth's economy has been felt in China, according to media reports on 16 March 2020, china's economy suffered a major recession in the first two months of 2020 due to steps taken by the government to curb the spread of the virus, which shopping malls have suffered by 20.5%

sourceString: As mainland China is a major economy and manufacturing hub, the viral outbreak has been seen to pose a major destabilizing threat to the global economy.
targetString: Njengoba izwe laseChina liyiskhondlakhondla ngokwezomnotho nokwakhiwa kwezinto, ukubhebhetheka kwale-virus kubukwe njengento esongela ukusimima komnotho womhlaba  wonke
en-mt: As China is an economic and structural powerhouse, the virus outbreak has been seen as a threat to the stability of the global economy

sourceString: Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit has forecast that markets will remain volatile until a clearer image emerges on potential outcomes.
targetString: uAgathe Demarais weEconomist Intelligence Unit ubikezele ukuthi izimakethe zizoqhubeka zingasimeme kuze kuvele isithombe esicacile ngokungase kube imiphumela.
en-mt: Agathe Demarais of theNomist Intelligence Unit predicted that markets would continue not invite us until a clearer picture emerged of potential results.

sourceString: In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the economic fallout of the epidemic on global growth could surpass that of the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak.
targetString: NgoJanuary 2020, abanye abahlaziyi basikisele ngokuthi imiphumela emibi ngokomnotho kwalolubhubhane ekukhuleni komnotho womhlaba ngase ingase iyidlule eyaphakathi nokubhebhetheka kwe SARS yango 2002-2004
en-mt: In January 2020, some analysts suggested that the economic effects of the pandemic on the world's economic growth may have exceeded those of the 2002-2004 SARS outbreak

sourceString: One estimate from an expert at Washington University in St. Louis gave a $300+ billion impact on the world's supply chain that could last up to two years.
targetString: Ukusikisela okukodwa okuvela esazini esiseWhashington University eSt. Louis sanikeza ukuthinteka okudlula u$300 bhiliyoni kubaphakeli bezokuthenga okungase kuhlale iminyaka emibili.
en-mt: One suggestion from the university atWhashington University in St. Louis provided more than $300 billion in impact to purchasing providers that could last up to two years.

sourceString: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) reportedly "scrambled" after a steep decline in oil prices due to lower demand from China.
targetString: I-Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) ngokwemibiko iyeyenza umyakazo ngokushsha ngemva kokwehla okukhulu kwamanani aoyela ngenxa yokuncipha kwesidingo eChina
en-mt: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) is reported to be making a fresh move after a sharp drop in oil prices due to declining demand in China

sourceString: Global stock markets fell on 24 February due to a significant rise in the number of COVID-19 cases outside mainland China.
targetString: Izimakethe zamasheya zomhlaba wonke zawa ngo 24 February ngenxa yokukhubuka kwesibalo sabanegciwane iCovid-19 ngaphandle kweChina
en-mt: Global stock markets fell on 24 February due to a rise in the number of Covid-19 cases outside China

sourceString: On 27 February, due to mounting worries about the coronavirus outbreak, various U.S. stock indexes including the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500 Index, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their sharpest falls since 2008, with the Dow falling 1,191 points, the largest one-day drop since the financial crisis of 2007–08.
targetString: Ngomhlaka 27 February, ngenxa yokwenyukela kokukhathazeka ngokubhebhetheka kwecoronavirus, abagcinibezibala zamasheya, kuhlanganise iNasdaq-100, iS&P 500 index kanye neDow Jones Industrial Average abika ukuwohloka okubi kakhulu kusukela ngo-2008, iDow yona yehla ngamaphuzu angu 1,191, ukwehla okukhulu kosuku ololudwa kusukela ngosizi lwango-2007 kuya ku-2008
en-mt: On 27 February, due to rising concerns about the coronavirus outbreak, shareholders, including the Nasdaq-100, S&P 500 index and the Dow Jones Industrial Average reported the worst recession since 2008, with the Dow dropping 1,191 points, the biggest single-day decline since the 2007 to 2008 recession

sourceString: All three indexes ended the week down more than 10%.
targetString: Womathathu ama-index aqeda isonto ehle ngaphezu ka-10%
en-mt: All three indexes finished the week down more than 10%

sourceString: On 28 February, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China's sovereign credit rating, but maintained a Negative Outlook.
targetString: Ngo-28 February, iScope Ratings GmBH yasekela ukwenemba kokulinganiswa kwamandla okuthenga ngesikweletu kweChina kodwa yaphikelela nombono ongemuhle ngekusasa
en-mt: On 28 February, Scope Ratings GmBH supported China's credit rating decline but persisted with a negative outlook for the morning

sourceString: Stocks plunged again based on coronavirus fears, the largest fall being on 16 March.
targetString: Amasheya aphahlazeka ngenxa yokwesatshwa kwecoronavirus, okukhulu kunakho konke kwaba ngo 16 Mashi
en-mt: Shares crashed due to coronavirus lockdown, the biggest of all was on 16 March

sourceString: Many consider an economic recession to be likely.
targetString: Abaningi bangolelwa ukuthi ukwehla komnotho kungenzeka
en-mt: Many are told that a recession is possible

sourceString: Economist Mohamed El-Erian praised central banks' and states' timely emergency measures.
targetString: Usozomnotho uMohamed E-Erian uncome amabhange nezizwe ngokuthatha izinyathelo ngokushesha mayelana nezimo eziphuthumayo
en-mt: Economist Mohamed E-Erian praised banks and nations for taking immediate action on emergencies

sourceString: Central banks are reacting more quickly than they did to the 2008 financial crash.
targetString: Amabhangeasebela ngokushesha kakhudlwana kunangenkathi yokuwa kwezimali zika 2008
en-mt: Banks responded faster than during the 2008 financial collapse

sourceString: Tourism is one of the worst affected sectors due to travel bans, closing of public places including travel attractions, and advice of governments against any travel all over the world.
targetString: Ezokuvakasha ezinye zezimboni eziphazqamiseke kakhulu ngenxa yokuvinjelwa kokuhamba, ukuvalwa kwezindawo zomphakathi kanye nezindawo zezivakashi kuhlanganise nezeluleko zohulumeni ngokumelene nohambo emhlabeni wonke.
en-mt: Tourism is some of the most popular industries due to travel restrictions, the closure of public spaces and tourist destinations as well as government advice against travel around the world.

sourceString: As a consequence, numerous airlines have cancelled flights due to lower demand, including British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, and Qantas, while British regional airline Flybe collapsed.
targetString: Ngokwemiphumela, izinkampani zezindize ziye zasula ukuhamba kwezindiza ngenxa yokwehla kwesidingo kuhlanganise neBritish Airways, China Eastern Airlines neQantas kanti inkampani yezindiza yaseBrithani iFlybe iwile.
en-mt: In terms of results, airlines have wiped out air travel due to falling demand including British Airways, China Eastern Airlines and Qantas and British airline Flybe has collapsed.

sourceString: The impact on the cruise line industry was at a level never seen before.
targetString: Ukuthinteka kwemboni yokuhamba ngemikhumbi yokungcebeleka kwakusezingeni elingakaze libonwe ngaphambilini.
en-mt: The impact of the cruise ship industry was on an unprecedented scale.

sourceString: Several train stations and ferry ports have also been closed.
targetString: Ezinye izikhungo zezitimela nezezikebhe ziyezavalwa.
en-mt: Some railway and railway stations are being closed.

sourceString: The epidemic coincided with the Chunyun, a major travel season associated with the Chinese New Year holiday.
targetString: Lolubhubhane lwenzeke sikhathi sinyene Chunyu, inkathi evelele yokuvakasha ehlotshaniswa NoNyaka Omusha waseChina.
en-mt: The pandemic has occurred during chunyu, the most prominent period of tourism associated with China's New Year.

sourceString: A number of events involving large crowds were cancelled by national and regional governments, including annual New Year festivals, with private companies also independently closing their shops and tourist attractions such as Hong Kong Disneyland and Shanghai Disneyland.
targetString: Imicimbi eminingi edonsa izixuku ezinkulu isuliwe ohulumeni bamazwe onke nawezifunda kuhlanganise imigubho yoNyaka Omusha nezinkampani ezizimele nazo zivala izitolo nezindawo zokujabulisa izivakashi njenge Hong Kong Disneyland kanye ne Shanghai Disneyland.
en-mt: Many events attracting large crowds have been cancelled by international and regional governments including New Year's Eve celebrations and private companies are also closing shops and tourist attractions such as Hong Kong Disneyland and Shanghai Disneyland.

sourceString: Many Lunar New Year events and tourist attractions have been closed to prevent mass gatherings, including the Forbidden City in Beijing and traditional temple fairs.
targetString: Imicimbi emininge yeLunar nezindawo zezivakashi nazo zivaliwe ukuze kuvinjelwe ukuhlangana kwabantu abaningi kuhlanganise iForbidden City eBeijing kanye nemicimbi yomdabu yasemaThempelini.
en-mt: Lunar intercity events and tourist destinations have also been closed to prevent large gatherings including the Forest City in Beijing and indigenous temple events.

sourceString: In 24 of China's 31 provinces, municipalities and regions, authorities extended the New Year's holiday to 10 February, instructing most workplaces not to re-open until that date.
targetString: Ezifundazweni, omasipala, izifunda ezingu 24 kwezingu 31 zaseChina, iziphathimandla zelule iholidi loNyaka Omusha ku 10 February, etshela zonke izindawo zokusebenza ukuthi zingavuli kuze kufike lolo suku.
en-mt: In provinces, municipalities, 24 of China's 31 provinces, authorities extended the New Year holiday to 10 February, telling all workplaces not to open until that date.

sourceString: These regions represented 80% of the country's GDP and 90% of exports.
targetString: Lezizifunda zimelele u 80% weGDP yezwe kanye no 90% wezimpahla ezthunyelwa kwamanye amazwe.
en-mt: These regions represent 80% of the country's GDP and 90% of exports.

sourceString: Hong Kong raised its infectious disease response level to the highest and declared an emergency, closing schools until March and cancelling its New Year celebrations.The retail sector has been impacted globally, with reductions in store hours or temporary closures.
targetString: iHong Kong inyuse izinga lokusabelela amagciwane athathelanayo aze afika ezingeni elisekugcineni kwaphawulwa nesimo esiphuthumayo, kwavalwa izikole kuze kube uMashi kwasulwa ukujatshulelwa konyaka omusha. Imboni yezokuthengisa iphazamiseke emhlabeni wonke kanye nokwehla kwamahora achithwe ezitolo noma ukuvalwa kwazo isikhashana.
en-mt: Hong Kong has increased the rate of transmission of infectious viruses to a level that was finally marked by an emergency, with schools closed until March and the new year's lockdown wiped out. The retail industry has been disrupted around the world with declining hours spent in stores or temporarily closing them.

sourceString: Visits to retailers in Europe and Latin America declined by 40%.
targetString: Ukukakashela ezitolo eEurope naseLatin America kwehla ngo 40%
en-mt: Shopping in Europe and Latin America fell 40%

sourceString: North America and Middle East retailers saw a 50–60% drop.
targetString: INyakatho Melika nePhakathi neMpumalanga abone ukehla kuka 50-60%
en-mt: North America and the Middle East have seen a drop of 50-60%

sourceString: This also resulted in a 33–43% drop in foot traffic to shopping centres in March compared to February.
targetString: Lokhu kube nomphumela wokwehla kuka-33 kuya ku-43% kwabantu abavakashela izitolo ezinkulu ngoMashi uma kuqhathaniswa noFebruary.
en-mt: This resulted in a 33 to 43% drop in people visiting supermarkets in March compared to February.

sourceString: Shopping mall operators around the world imposed additional measures, such increased sanitation, installation of thermal scanners to check the temperature of shoppers, and cancellation of events.According to a United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America estimate, the pandemic-induced recession could leave between 14 and 22 million more people in extreme poverty in Latin America than would have been in that situation without the pandemic.
targetString: Abanikazi bama-shopping mall emhlabeni wonke abeke imigomo emisha , njengokunyua ukuhlanzwa nokufakwa kwama-thermal scanners. ukuze kubonwe izinga lokushisa kubathengi kanye nokwesulwa kwemicimbi. Ngobona kweUnited Nations Economic Commission for Latin America ukwehla komnotho okubangelwe ubhubhane kungase kushiye abantu abayizigidi ezingu-14 kuya ku-22 behlupheka kakhulu kunalokho obekuzobayikho ngaphandle kwalolubhubhane.
en-mt: Shopping mall owners around the world have imposed new regulations, such as cleaning cleaning and installation of thermal scanners. to determine the temperature of customers and the cancellation of events. At the discretion of the United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America the economic downturn caused by the pandemic may leave 14 to 22 million people suffering more than they would have been without the pandemic.

sourceString: In January and February 2020, during the height of the epidemic in Wuhan, about 5 million people in China lost their jobs.
targetString: Ngo-January no- February 2020, phakathi nokuphakama komshayabhuqe e-Wuhan, izigidi ezingu-5 zabantu e-China balahlekelwa imisebenzi yabo.
en-mt: In January and February 2020, amid the height of the plague in Wuhan, 5 million people in China lost their jobs.

sourceString: Many of China's nearly 300 million rural migrant workers have been stranded at home in inland provinces or trapped in Hubei province.In March 2020, more than 10 million Americans lost their jobs and applied for government aid.
targetString: Ininingi labasebenzi abangase babe ngu-300 million abahambahambayo bavimbe emakhaya abo asezifundazweni ezingaphakathi noma babambeke esifundazweni sase-Hubei. Ngo-March 2020, izigidi ezingaphezulu kuka-10 zabase-America zalahlekelwa imisebenzi yazo futhi zacela usizo lukahulumeni.
en-mt: Most of the potentially 300 million mobile workers have blocked their homes in the interior provinces or are trapped in Hubei province. In March 2020, more than 10 million Americans lost their jobs and asked for government help.

sourceString: The coronavirus outbreak could cost 47 million jobs in the United States and unemployment rate may hit 32%, according to estimates by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.The lockdown in India has left tens of millions of Indian migrant workers (who are paid through daily wages) unemployed.The survey from the Angus Reid Institute found that 44% of Canadian households have experienced some type of unemployment.Nearly 900,000 workers lost their jobs in Spain since it went into lockdown in mid-March 2020.
targetString: Ubhubhane lwecoronovirus lungase ludle imisebenzi eyizigidi ezingu 47 eUnited States futhi inani labangasebenzi lingafika ku 32% ngokubuka kweFederal Reserve Bank of st Louis. Ukuvalelwa eNdiya lushiye amashumi ezigidi zabasebenzi betoho bamandiya abaholelwa ngosuku bengasebenzi. Ucwaningo olwenziwe iAngus Rei Institute luthole ukuthi amakhaya aseCanada angu 44% ake aba nokuthintwa ukungasebenzi. Abasebenzi abacishe babe u-900 000 eSpain balahlekelwa imisebenzi yabo kusukela kwaqala ukuvalwa kwezwe phakathi noMashi 2020.
en-mt: The coronavirus pandemic could consume 47 million jobs in the United States and the unemployment rate could reach 32% according to the Federal Reserve Bank of st. Louis. The detention in India has left tens of millions of indian cotton workers led on a day out of work. A study by the Angus Rei Institute found that 44% of Canadian households have been contacted for inactivity. Nearly 900,000 workers in Spain have lost their jobs since the country's lockdown began in mid-March 2020.

sourceString: During the second half of March, 4 million French workers applied for temporary unemployment benefits and 1 million British workers applied for a universal credit scheme.Almost half a million companies in Germany have sent their workers on a government-subsidized short-time working schemes known as Kurzarbeit.
targetString: Phakathi nengxenye eyesibili yaMashi, abasebenzi abangu-4 million  baseFrance babhalisele izibonelelo zesikhashana kanye nabasebenzi baseBrithani abangu-1 million babhalisele i-universal credit scheme. Izinkampani ezingase zibe yisigamu sesigidi eJalimane baye bayisa abasebenzi ohlelweni lukahulumeni lokusebenza isikhathi esincishisiwe esibizwa ngokuthi iKurzarbeit.
en-mt: During the second half of March, 4 million French workers signed up for temporary benefits and 1 million British workers signed up for the universal credit scheme. Some half a million companies in Germany have moved workers to a reduced-term government operating system called Kurzarbeit.

sourceString: The German short-time work compensation scheme has been adopted by France and Britain.
targetString: Lolu hlelo lwaseJalimane lokusebenza isikhathi esifushanisiwe liye lathathwa nayiFrance neBrithani.
en-mt: This German short-term operating system has also been adopted by France and Britain.

sourceString: The performing arts and cultural heritage sectors have been profoundly affected by the pandemic, impacting organizations' operations as well as individuals—both employed and independent—globally.
targetString: Izimboni zobiciko namasiko intinteke ngokuphawulekayo yilolubhubhane kwaphazamiseka ukusebenza kwezinhlangano nabantu siqu -abaqashiwe nabazimele -emhlabeni wonke
en-mt: The arts and culture industries have been dramatically affected by the pandemic and disrupted the performance of organisations and individuals - employed and independent - around the world

sourceString: Arts and culture sector organizations attempted to uphold their (often publicly funded) mission to provide access to cultural heritage to the community, maintain the safety of their employees and the public, and support artists where possible.
targetString: Izinhlangano zezobuciko nezamasiko zizame ukuqhubezaizinhlelo zazo, ngokuvamile ezixhaswa uhulumeni, ukuvulela umphakathi izidawo nokugcine izisebenzi zabo nomphakathi bephephile kanye nokusekela izihlabani.
en-mt: Arts and cultural organisations have tried to advance their programmes, often government-backed, to open up communities and keep their staff and communities safe and support the community.

sourceString: By March 2020, across the world and to varying degrees, museums, libraries, performance venues, and other cultural institutions had been indefinitely closed with their exhibitions, events and performances cancelled or postponed.
targetString: Kwathi ngoMashi 2020, emhlabeni wonke nangamazinga angafani, amamuseaums, amalibrary, izindawo okudlala nezindawo zamasiko zavalwa isikhathi esinganqunyiwe, imicibi nemidlalo asulwa noma yahlehliswa.
en-mt: Then in March 2020, around the world at varying levels, museums, libraries, playgrounds and cultural venues were closed in an uninterrupted period, with artists and games canceled or postponed.

sourceString: In response there were intensive efforts to provide alternative services through digital platforms.Another recent and rapidly accelerating fallout of the disease is the cancellation of religious services, major events in sports, and other social events, such as music festivals and concerts, technology conferences, and fashion shows.
targetString: Kwasatshelwa ngokuthi kwenziwe imizamo yokuba izidingo zitholakale ngezindlela zobuchwepheshe. Okunye okusha nokushesha kakhulu ukwesulwa kwezihnhlelo zenkolo, ezemidlalo neminye imicimbi yabantu njengamafestival namaconcert namaconference ezobuchwepheshe kanye nawezemfashini.
en-mt: It was reported that efforts were made to make the needs available through technology. Also new and faster is the cancellation of religious, sports and other public events such as festivals and conferences and technical and fashion conferences.

sourceString: The film industry has also experienced disruption.The Vatican announced that Holy Week observances in Rome, which occur during the last week of the Christian penitential season of Lent, have been cancelled.
targetString: Imboni yezemidlalo ebukwayo iye yaphazamiseka. iVatican imemezele ukuthi ukukhunjulwa kweHoly Week eRoma, okwenzeka ngesonto lokugcina kwenyanga yamaKristu yeLent isuliwe.
en-mt: The visual sports industry has been disrupted. the Vatican has announced that the commemoration of Holy Week in Rome, which takes place on the last week of Lent Christian month has been cancelled.

sourceString: Many dioceses have recommended older Christians to stay at home rather than attending Mass on Sundays; some churches have made church services available via radio, online live streaming or television while others are offering drive-in worship.
targetString: Amadioceses aye akhuthaza amaKristu asekhulile ukuba ahlale emakhaya kunokuya emasontweni ngamaSonto. Amanye amasonto enze izinhlelo zawo zatholakak ngosmakazo, i-live streaming noma ngethelevision.
en-mt: The dioceses have encouraged older Christians to stay at home rather than go to church on Sundays. Some churches have made their programs available through streaming, live streaming or television.

sourceString: With the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rome closing its churches and chapels and St. Peter's Square emptied of Christian pilgrims, other religious bodies also cancelled services and limited public gatherings in churches, mosques, synagogues, temples and gurdwaras.
targetString: Ngokuthi iRoman Catholic Diocese of Rome ivale amasonto ayo kanye neSt Peter's Square ikhiphe wonke amapilgrim nezinye izinhlangano ziye zasula izinhlelo noma zaba nemibuthano elinganiselwe emasontweni, amamosques, amasinagoge, amathempeli namagurdwaras
en-mt: By having the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rome close its churches and St Peter's Square to remove all pilgrims and other organizations they have canceled or had limited gatherings in churches, mosques, synagogues, temples and gurdwaras

sourceString: Iran's Health Ministry announced the cancellation of Friday prayers in areas affected by the outbreak and shrines were later closed, while Saudi Arabia banned the entry of foreign pilgrims as well as its residents to holy sites in Mecca and Medina.
targetString: Umnyango Wezempilo eIran wamemezela ukusulwa kwemithandazo yangolwesihlanu ezindaweni ezithintwe yilolubhubhane nezindawo ezokukhonza zavalwa kanti eSaudi Arabia kwavinjelwa kwamakholwa amanye amazwe nezakhamuzi akhona ukungena ezakhiweni ezingcwele eMecca naseMedina.
en-mt: Iran's Ministry of Health announced the cancellation of Friday prayers in pandemic-affected areas and places of worship were closed and saudi Arabia banned foreign believers and citizens from entering sacred buildings in Mecca and Medina.

sourceString: The pandemic has caused the most significant disruption to the worldwide sporting calendar since the Second World War.
targetString: Lolu bhubhane ludale ukuphazamiseka okukhulu kunakho konke ezinhlelweni zezemidlalo emhlabeni wonke kusukela eMpini Yezwe Yesibili.
en-mt: The pandemic has created the biggest disruption to sports programs around the world since the Second World War.

sourceString: Most major sporting events have been either cancelled or postponed, including the 2019–20 UEFA Champions League, 2019–20 Premier League, UEFA Euro 2020, 2019–20 NBA season, and 2019–20 NHL season.
targetString: Eziningi ezemidlalo emikhulu ziye zahlehliswa noma zayekwa ngokuphelele, kuhlanganise i-2019 kuya ku-2020 UEFA Champions League, i-2019 kuya ku-2020 Premier League, i-UEFA Euro ka-2020, i-2019 kuya ku-2020 NBA Season kanye ne-2019  kuya ku-2020 NHL season.
en-mt: Many major sports have been postponed or completely canceled, including the 2019 to 2020 UEFA Champions League, 2019 to 2020 Premier League, UEFA Euro for 2020, 2019 to 2020 NBA Season and 2019 to 2020 NHL season.

sourceString: The outbreak disrupted plans for the 2020 Summer Olympics, which were originally scheduled to start at the end of July; the International Olympic Committee announced on 24 March that the event will be "rescheduled to a date beyond 2020 but not later than summer 2021".Casinos and other gaming venues worldwide have closed and live poker tournaments have been either postponed or cancelled.
targetString: Lokhu qubuka kuphazamise izinhlelo ze-2020 Summer Olympics ezazikade zihlelelwe ukuqala ngasekupheleni kuka-July; I-International Olympic Committee yamemezela ngo-24 March ukuthi lemidlalo "izophinde sihlelelwe inkathi engemva kuka-2020 kodwa kukakadluli i-hlobo ka-2021". Ama-Casino nezinye izindawo zemidlalo emhlabeni wonke zivaliwe nemiqhudelwano ye-poker ebukhoma ihlehlisiwe noma ihoxiswe.
en-mt: This outbreak disrupted plans for the 2020 Summer Olympics that had been scheduled to begin in late July; The International Olympic Committee announced on 24 March that the Games "will be postponed for the post-2020 period but not beyond the summer of 2021". Casinos and other sports venues around the world are closed and live poker tournaments have been postponed or cancelled.

sourceString: This has led many gamblers to move online, with many online gambling sites reporting significant increases in their rates of new sign-ups.The entertainment industry has also been affected, with various music groups suspending or cancelling concert tours.
targetString: Loku kuye kwaholela ekutheni abagembuli baye-online, ama-site amaningi okugembula abike ukwanda okukhulu kwama-sign-ups. Imboni yokuzijabulisa nayo ithintekile, amaqembu omculo aye amisa noma ahoxisa uhambo lwama-concert.
en-mt: This has led to gamblers going online, with many gambling sites reporting a significant increase in sign-ups. The entertainment industry has also been affected, with music groups suspending or canceling concert tours.

sourceString: Many large theatres such as those on Broadway also suspended all performances.
targetString: Imidlalo eminingi yezeshashalazi njengaleyo ese-Broadway iyeyamisa yonke imibukiso.
en-mt: Many theaters like the one on Broadway are stopping all shows.

sourceString: Some artists have explored ways to continue to produce and share work over the internet as an alternative to traditional live performance, such as live streaming concerts or creating web-based "festivals" for artists to perform, distribute, and publicize their work.
targetString: Abaculi abathile bahlole izindlela zokuqhubeka beqopha nezokwabelana ngomsebenzi wabo nge-internet esikhundleni sokudlala bukhoma njengokuvamile, njengokwenza i-live streaming yama-concert noma ukusungula "imicimbi" e-web based yokuthi abaculi badlale, basakaze futhi bazise abantu kabanzi ngomsebenzi wabo.
en-mt: Some artists have explored ways to continue recording and sharing their work online instead of playing live as usual, such as doing live streaming of concerts or establishing web-based "events" for artists to play, broadcast and inform people more about their work.

sourceString: Online, numerous coronavirus-themed Internet memes have spread as many turn to humour and distraction amid uncertainty.
targetString: Amamingi ama-meme aphathelene necorona-virus aye abhebhetheka online njengoba abaningi bephendukela emahlayeni neziphazamiso phakathi nokingaqiniseki.
en-mt: Dozens of coronavirus-related memes have been circulating online as many turn to social media and distractions amid uncertainty.

sourceString: Since the outbreak of COVID-19, heightened prejudice, xenophobia, and racism have been noted toward people of Chinese and East Asian descent, and against people from hotspots in Europe, the United States and other countries.
targetString: Kusukela yagqashuka i-COVID -19, izinga eliphakeme lokubandlululwa, elokucwaswa ngobuzwe nelokucwaswa ngebala liye laphawulwa ngokuqondene nabantu imvelaphi yabo engeyase-China nase-East Asia futhi nangokumelene nabantu abavela ezindaweni ezithile e-Europe , e-United States kanye namanye amazwe.
en-mt: Since the outbreak of COVID-19, high levels of discrimination, racism and racism have been marked with respect to people of non-China and East Asian backgrounds and against people from certain parts of Europe, the United States and other countries.

sourceString: Incidents of fear, suspicion, and hostility have been observed in many countries, particularly in Europe, East Asia, North America, and the Asia-Pacific region.
targetString: Izigameko zokwesaba, ukusola nobutha ziye zaqhashelwa emazweni amaningi ikakhulukazi e-Europe, East Asia, North America kanye nasesifundeni sase-Asia-Pacific.
en-mt: Cases of fear, resentment and bigotry have been reported in many countries especially in Europe, East Asia, North America and the Asia-Pacific region.

sourceString: Reports from February (when the majority of the cases had still been confined to China) have documented racist sentiments expressed in various groups worldwide of Chinese people deserving the virus or receiving what has been claimed as justified retribution.
targetString: Imibiko yango-February, lapho iningi abagulayo babesangaphakathi kwemingcele yase-China, yaphawula imizwa yokucwaswa ngebala ivezwa amaqembu ahlukahlukene emhlabeni ngokuthi abantu base-China bafanelwe yile-virus noma bathola okuthiwa impindiselo ebafanele.
en-mt: Reports in February, when most of the patients were still within China's borders, noted feelings of racism expressed by various groups around the world that Chinese people deserve the virus or receive so-called retaliation they deserve.

sourceString: Some countries in Africa have also seen a rise in anti-Chinese sentiment.
targetString: Amanye amazwe ase-Africa aye abona ukwanda kokungabathandisisi abase-China.
en-mt: Some African countries have seen an increase in the number of aiders in China.

sourceString: Many residents of Wuhan and Hubei have reported discrimination based on their regional origin.
targetString: Izakhamuzi eziningi zaseWuhan naseHubei zibike ukubandululwa ngenxa yezindawo abavela kuso
en-mt: Many Residents of Wuhan and Hubei reported being let go because of their origins

sourceString: There has been support for the Chinese, both on and offline, and towards those in virus-stricken areas.
targetString: Kubekhona ukusekelwa kwabase-China kokubili ezingosini zokuxhumana nanokoqobo kulabo abasezindaweni ezihaqwe yile-virus.
en-mt: There has been Chinese support for both social and physical networks for those in areas affected by the virus.

sourceString: Following the progression of the outbreak to new hotspot countries, people from Italy, the first country in Europe to experience a serious outbreak of COVID-19, could also be subjected to suspicion and xenophobia.Citizens in countries including Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, and South Korea initially signed petitions lobbying to ban Chinese people from entering their countries in an effort to stop the disease.
targetString: Okulandele ukuqhubekela kwamanye amazwe athile kwaloku kugqashuka, abantu base-Italy, okuyizwe lokuqala e-Europe lokuba nokugqashuka kwe-Covid-19 okubucayi, bangase babhekane nokusolwa nangokucwaswa ngobuzwe. Izakhamuzi zamazwe ahlanganisa i-Malaysia, i-New Zealand, i-Singapore ne-South Korea zike zaqala usayina izicelo ezihambisana nemikhankaso yokuvimbela abantu base-China ukuthi bangangeni emazweni akubo njengomzamo wokunqanda lesifo.
en-mt: Following the continuation of some of the same outbreaks, Italians, the first country in Europe to have a critical Covid-19 outbreak, may face criticism and racism. Citizens of countries including Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore and South Korea have begun signing petitions accompanying campaigns to prevent People of China from entering their countries as an effort to contain the disease.

sourceString: In Japan, the hashtag #ChineseDontComeToJapan trended on Twitter.
targetString: E-Japan, i-hashtag #ChineseDontComeToJapan iye yaba edumile ku-Twitter.
en-mt: In Japan, the hashtag #ChineseDontComeToJapan has become popular on Twitter.

sourceString: Chinese people as well as other Asians in the United Kingdom and the United States have reported increasing levels of racist abuse, as well as assaults.
targetString: Abantu base-China namanye ama-Asian e-United Kingdom nase-United States babike amazinga andayo okuhlukunyezwa ngenxa yokucwaswa ngebala kanye nokushaywa.
en-mt: People in China and other Asian countries in the United Kingdom and the United States have reported increasing rates of harassment due to racism and beatings.

sourceString: U.S. president Donald Trump has faced criticism for referring to the coronavirus as the "Chinese Virus", a term considered by critics to be racist and anti-Chinese.
targetString: Umongameli wase-U.S u-Donald Trump usebhekane nokugxekwa ngokubhekisela kwi-coronavirus ngokuthi "i-Chinese Virus", igama abagxeki abalibheka njengelicwasa ngokwebala futhi elibonisa ukungabathandisisi abaseChina.
en-mt: U.S. President Donald Trump has faced criticism for referring to the coronavirus as the "Chinese Virus", a term critics view as racist and that reflects the lack of support in China.

sourceString: Protesters in Ukraine attacked buses carrying Ukrainian and foreign evacuees from Wuhan to Novi Sanzhary.
targetString: Ababhikishi e-Ukraine bahlasele amabhasi athwele abase-Ukraine kanye nabakwamanye amazwe ababuyiswe e-Wuhan bayiswa e-Novi Sanzhary.
en-mt: Protesters in Ukraine attacked buses carrying Ukrainians and foreigners returned from Wuhan to Novi Sanzhary.

sourceString: Students who come from Northeast India, which shares a border with China, and study in major Indian cities have reportedly experienced harassment related to the coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Abafundi abavela e-Northeast India, enomgcele ne-China futhi abafunda emadolobheni amakhulu e-India, ngokwemibiko, sebetholane nokuhlushwa okuphathelene nokugqashuka kwe-coronavirus.
en-mt: Students from Northeast India, which borders China and study in major cities in India, according to reports, have already experienced coronavirus outbreak-related suffering.

sourceString: The Bharatiya Janata Party's State unit president in West Bengal Dilip Ghosh stated that the Chinese had destroyed nature and "that's why the God took revenge against them."
targetString: Umongameli we-The Bharatiya Janata Party e-West Bengal u-Dilip Ghosh wathi abase-China bayibulele imvelo futhi "yingakho unkulunkulu eziphindiselelile kubona"
en-mt: The Bharatiya Janata Party president in West Bengal Dilip Ghosh said the Chinans have told nature and "that's why the god has retaliated against them"

sourceString: The remarks were later condemned by the Chinese consulate in Kolkata, calling it "erroneous".In China, xenophobia and racism agains non-Chinese residents has been inflamed by the pandemic, with foreigners described as "foreign garbage" and targeted for "disposal".
targetString: Lezi zinkulumo ziye zalahlwa ihhovisi lenxusa lase-China e-Kolkata, lizibiza ngokuthi "ziyiphutha". E-China, ukuchwasa ngobuzwe nokuchwasa ngebala kulabo abangebona abase-China kuye kwanikezwa umfutho yilolubhubhane, abavela kwamanye amazwe bebebizwa ngokuthi "izibi zangaphandle" futhi zihlelelwe "ukuchithwa"
en-mt: The speeches have been dismissed by the China embassy in Kolkata, calling them "flawed". In China, racism and racism against non-China have been given a boost by the pandemic, with foreigners being dubbed "foreign evils" and set to be "dismantled"

sourceString: Many newspapers with paywalls have removed them for some or all of their coronavirus coverage.
targetString: Amaphephandaba amaningi akhokhelwayo akuhoxisile okuthile ukukhokhelwa noma akuyekise ngokuphelele ngokuqondene nezindaba eziphathelene ne-coronavirus.
en-mt: Many paid newspapers have cancelled some payments or completely suspended them regarding coronavirus-related issues.

sourceString: Many scientific publishers made scientific papers related to the outbreak available with open access.
targetString: Abanyathelisi bezesayensi abaniningi benze amaphepha esayensi aphathelene nalokhu kugqashuka atholokala ngokukhululekile.
en-mt: Many scientific publishers have made scientific papers on this explosion that are freely available.

sourceString: Some scientists chose to share their results quickly on preprint servers such as bioRxiv.
targetString: Abanye ososayensi bakhethe ukwabelana nabanye imiphumela yabo ngokushesha kuma-preprint servers anjenge-bioRxiv.
en-mt: Some scientists have chosen to share their results quickly with others on preprint servers such as bioRxiv.

sourceString: Emerging infectious disease – Infectious disease of emerging pathogen, often novel in its outbreak range or transmission mode
targetString: Izifo ezintsha ezithelelanayo – Izifo ezithelelanayo zamagciwane amasha, ngokuvamile masha ebangeni lawo lokuqubuka noma endleleni yodluliselana
en-mt: New infectious diseases – Infectious diseases of new viruses, often new to their rate of onset or transmission pathway

sourceString: Globalization and disease – Overview of globalization and disease transmission
targetString: Ukusondelana emhlabeni – Ukubuka konke ukusondelana emhlabeni nokudlulisa izifo
en-mt: Approaching the world – Observing all the world's proximity and transmitting diseases

sourceString: List of epidemics and pandemics – A list of death tolls due to infectious disease
targetString: Uhlu lobhubhane nemishayabhuqe – Uhlu lwezibalo zokufa ngenxa yesifo esithathelanayo
en-mt: List of epidemics and epidemics – List of death statistics for infectious disease

sourceString: Wildlife smuggling and zoonoses – Health risks associated with the trade in exotic wildlife
targetString: Ukushushumbisa izilwane zasendle nezifo zezilwane ezidluliselwa kubantu  – Izingozi zezempilo ezihlobene nokuhwebelana ngezilwane zasendle
en-mt: Wildlife heating and human-transmitted animal diseases – Health risks related to wildlife trade

sourceString: Laboratory testing for the respiratory coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the associated SARS-CoV-2 virus includes methods that detect the presence of virus and those that detect antibodies produced in response to infection.
targetString: Ukuhlolelwa kwe-repiratory coronavirus disease 2019 Covid-19 kanye ne-SARS-CoV-2 virus ephathelene nayo inhlanganisa izindlela zokubona ukubakhona kwe-virus kanye nalezo ezibona ama-antibodies akhekayo njengomphumela uma umuntu etheleleka.
en-mt: Repiratory testing for coronavirus disease 2019 Covid-19 and related SARS-CoV-2 virus includes ways to detect the presence of the virus and those that detect antibodies that form as a result if someone is infected.

sourceString: The presence of viruses in samples is confirmed by RT-PCR, which detects the coronavirus'  RNA.
targetString: Ukubakhona kwama-viruses kuma-samples kuqinisekiswa i-RT-PCR ebona ukubakhona kwe-RNA ye-coronavirus.
en-mt: The presence of viruses in samples is confirmed by RT-PCR which sees the presence of coronavirus RNA.

sourceString: This test is specific and is designed to only detect the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: lolucwaningo lwenzelwe ngokukhethekile ukuhlola i-RNA ye-SARS-Cov-2 virus.
en-mt: this study is specifically designed to test RNA for SARS-Cov-2 virus.

sourceString: It is used to confirm very recent or active infections.
targetString: Isebenziselwa ukuqinisekisa ukutholeka kwesifo okusanda kwedlula noma okusekhona.
en-mt: It is used to confirm the diagnosis of a disease that has recently passed or is still present.

sourceString: Detection of antibodies (serology) can be used both for diagnosis and population surveillance.
targetString: Ukuwaningela kwama-antibodies ,i-serology, kungasebenziselwa kokubili ukuhlolwa kwesifo esikumuntu noma ukuqashwa komphakhathi.
en-mt: Diagnosis of antibodies, serology, can be used for both in-person clinical trials or on-time recruitment.

sourceString: Antibody tests show how many people have had the disease, including those whose symptoms were too minor to report or who were asymptomatic.
targetString: Ukuhlolwa kama-antibody kubonisa ukuthi bangaki abantu asebeke baba naso isifo kuhlanganise nalabo izimpawu zabo zazincane kakhulu ukuthi zazingabikwa noma abangenazo nhlobo izimpawu.
en-mt: Antibody tests show how many people have had the disease including those whose symptoms were so mild that they were unreported or had no symptoms.

sourceString: An accurate mortality rate of the disease and the level of herd immunity in the population can be determined from the results of this test.
targetString: Isibalo esinembile sezinga lokufa kwabantu ngalesifo kanye nezinga lokungatheleleki kweningi emphakathini kungatholakala emphumelweni yalolu vivinyo.
en-mt: An accurate mortality rate for this disease and the level of social immunity can be found in the results of this trial.

sourceString: Due to limited testing, as of March 2020 no countries had reliable data on the prevalence of the virus in their population.
targetString: Ngenxa yokulinganiselwa kwamanani okuhlolwa, ngesikhathi sika-March 2020, awekho amazwe abenezibalo ezingathenjwa mayelana nesibalo sokusabalala kwe-virus emphakathini wawo.
en-mt: Due to the limited testing rates, during March 2020, no countries had reliable statistics on the number of virus spreads in their communities.

sourceString: By 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of their population, and there are massive variations in how much testing has been done across countries.
targetString: Ngo-23 March, alikho izwe ebeselihlole ngaphezu kuka-3 % wabantu abasemazweni awo futhi kukhona ukuhluka okukhulu kwenani lezibalo zokuhlolwa osekwenziwe emazweni ahlukahlukene.
en-mt: By 23 March, no country had tested more than 3 % of its population and there is a significant difference in the number of test statistics that have been done in various countries.

sourceString: This variability is also likely to be significantly affecting reported case fatality rates, which are likely to be significantly over-estimated in some countries.
targetString: Loku kuhluka kungenzeka ukuthi kuthinta kakhulu amanani okufa kwabantu abikiwe okungenzeka zeqe ngehaba kwamazwe athile.
en-mt: This variation is likely to have a significant impact on the reported death rates that are likely to be higher in some countries.

sourceString: Using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) the test can be done on respiratory samples obtained by various methods, including nasopharyngeal swab or sputum sample.
targetString: Ngokusetshenziswa kwe-real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction, i-rRt-PCR, lokuhlola kungenziwa kuma-respiratory samples atholwe ngezindlela ezihlukahlukene, kuhlanganise ne-nasopharyngeal swab noma i-sputum sample.
en-mt: With the use of real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction, rRt-PCR, testing can be done on respiratory samples obtained in a variety of ways, including a nasopharyngeal swab or sputum sample.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to 2 days.
targetString: Imiphumela ngokuvamile itholakala phakathi namahora amabili kuya ezinsukwini ezingu-2.
en-mt: Results are usually available between two hours to 2 days.

sourceString: The RT-PCR test performed with throat swabs is only reliable in the first week of the disease.
targetString: Ukuhlola okubizwa nge-RT-PCR okwenziwa ngama-swab omphimbo kungaba nokuthenjelwa esontweni lokuqala kuphela kokophathwa yisifo.
en-mt: So-called RT-PCR tests performed with voice swabs can be relied upon in the first week only for infection.

sourceString: Later on the virus can disappear in the throat while it continues to multiply in the lungs.
targetString: Ngokuzayo, i-virus inganyamalala emphinjeni kodwa ibe iqhubeka yanda emaphaphini.
en-mt: In the future, the virus may disappear from the throat but continue to multiply in the lungs.

sourceString: For infected people tested in the second week, alternatively sample material can then be taken from the deep airways by suction catheter or coughing up material (sputum) can be used.
targetString: Kubantu abenegciwane abahlolwe ngesonto lesibili, okunye i-sample material ingakhishwa ekujuleni kwemizila yokuhogela nge-suction catheter noma ngokukhwehlela i-material, sputum, ingasebenziswa.
en-mt: For infected people who tested positive in the second week, some sample material can be extracted from the depth of the suction catheter via suction catheter or by coughing the material, sputum, can be used.

sourceString: One of the early PCR tests was developed at Charité in Berlin in January 2020 using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR), and formed the basis of 250,000 kits for distribution by the World Health Organization (WHO).
