targetString: Ezinye zezindlela zokuhlola zokuqala ze-PCR zathuthukiswa e-Charite e-Berlin ngo-January 2020 kusebenziswa i-real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction ,irRT-PCR, okwenza isisekelo sokusakazwa kwama khithi angu-250,000 yi-World Health Organization, WHO.
en-mt: Some of the first PCR testing methods were developed at Charite in Berlin in January 2020 using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction,IRRT-PCR, which forms the basis for the distribution of 250,000 kits by the World Health Organization, WHO.

sourceString: The United Kingdom had also developed a test by 23 January 2020.The South Korean company Kogenebiotech developed a clinical grade, PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit (PowerChek Coronavirus) on 28 January 2020.
targetString: I-United Kingdom nayo yayisithuthukise indlela yokuhlola ngo-23 January 2020. Inkampany yase-South Korea i-Kogenebiotech yathuthukisa iPCR-based SARSCoV-2 kit yokuhlola esezingeni lokusebenza emtholampilo ngo-28 January 2020.
en-mt: The United Kingdom had also improved the testing method on 23 January 2020. South Korean company Kogenebiotech upgraded the PCR-based SARSCoV-2 clinical-level testing kit on 28 January 2020.

sourceString: It looks for the "E" gene shared by all beta coronaviruses, and the RdRp gene specific to SARS-CoV-2.In China, BGI Group was one of the first companies to receive emergency use approval from China's National Medical Products Administration for a PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit.In the United States, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is distributing its 2019-Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel to public health labs through the International Reagent Resource.
targetString: Ithungatha "i-E gene" efanayo kuwo wonke ama-beta coronaviruses kanye ne-RdRp gene etholakala kuphela kuyi-SARS-CoV-2. E-China, iBGI Group yayingezinye zezinkampani ezathola ukuvunyelwa wezikhathi ezibucayi i-National Products Administration yase-China ukusebenzisa i-kit yokuhlola i-PCR-based SARS-CoV-2. E-United States, i-Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, CDC, isakaza i-2019-Novel Coronavirus, 2019-Novel, Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel ezikhungweni zomtholampilo zokuhlola ngokusebenzisa i-International Reagent Resource.
en-mt: It traces the same "E gene" to all beta coronaviruses and the RdRp gene found only in SARS-CoV-2. In China, BGI Group was one of the companies that received approval for sensitive periods the National Products Administration of China to use the PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 testing kit. In the United States, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, CDC, is distributing the 2019-Novel Coronavirus, 2019-Novel, Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel to clinical testing centers through the International Reagent Resource.

sourceString: One of three genetic tests in older versions of the test kits caused inconclusive results due to faulty reagents, and a bottleneck of testing at the CDC in Atlanta; this resulted in an average of fewer than 100 samples a day being successfully processed throughout the whole of February 2020.
targetString: Ezintathu zama-genetic tests ezindleleni eziyisdala zama-kit okuhlola zabangela imiphumela engacacile ngenxa yaba-reagants angasebenzi kahle nokucinana kokuhlola e-CDC e-Atlanta, lokhu kwaphumela esilinganisweni sama-samples esingaphansi kwang-100 ngosuku aphumelela kuwo wonke u-February 2020.
en-mt: Three genetic tests on older methods of test kits resulted in vague results due to malfunctioning reagants and limited testing at the CDC in Atlanta, resulting in a sample ratio of less than 100 per day won throughout February 2020.

sourceString: Tests using two components were not determined to be reliable until 28 February 2020, and it was not until then that state and local laboratories were permitted to begin testing.
targetString: Ukuhlola kusebenziswa izingxenye ezimbili akutholwanga kungathenjelwa kwaze kwaba u-28 February 2020 futhi kwaze kwaba yileso sikhathi lapho izikhungo zokuhlola zesifundazwe nezendawo zivunyelwa ukuqala ukuhlola.
en-mt: Testing used in two parts was not found to be reliable until 28 February 2020 and until then provincial and local testing centres were allowed to begin testing.

sourceString: The test was approved by the Food and Drug Administration under an Emergency Use Authorization.US commercial labs began testing in early March 2020.
targetString: Lendlela yokuhlola yagunyazwa i-Food and Drug Administration ngaphansi kwe-Emergency Use Authorization. Izikhungo zokuhlola ezizimele zaqala ukuhlola ekuqaleni kuka-March 2020.
en-mt: This testing method was authorized by the Food and Drug Administration under an Emergency Use Authorization. Independent testing centres began testing in early March 2020.

sourceString: As of 5 March 2020 LabCorp announced nationwide availability of COVID-19 testing based on RT-PCR.
targetString: Ngo-5 March 2020 i-LabCorp yamemezela ukutholakala ezweni lonke kokuhlolelwa kwe-COVID-19 okusekelwe kwi-RT-PCR
en-mt: On 5 March 2020 LabCorp announced the nationwide availability of RT-PCR-based COVID-19 test

sourceString: Quest Diagnostics similarly made nationwide COVID-19 testing available as of 9 March 2020.
targetString: I-Quest Diagnostics ngokufanayo yenze ukuhlolelwa i-COVID-19 kwatholakala ngokusukela kuka-9 March 2020
en-mt: Quest Diagnostics similarly made COVID-19 diagnosis available from 9 March 2020

sourceString: No quantity limitations were announced; specimen collection and processing must be performed according to CDC requirements.
targetString: Akukho ukulinganiselwa kwezibalo okwamenyezelwa, ukuqoqwa nokugaywa kwama-specimen kufanele kwenziwe ngokwezimfuneko ze-CDC.
en-mt: No statistical limitations have been announced, the collection and digestion of specimens should be done according to CDC requirements.

sourceString: In Russia, the COVID-19 test was developed and produced by the State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR.
targetString: E-Russia , ukuhlolela i-COVID-19 kwathuthukiswa futhi kwakhiqizwa i-State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR
en-mt: In Russia , COVID-19 testing was developed and produced by the State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR

sourceString: On 11 February 2020 the test was registered by the Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare.On 12 March 2020, Mayo Clinic was reported to have developed a test to detect COVID-19 infection.On 13 March 2020, Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for a test which could be performed within 3.5 hours in high volume, thus allowing one machine to do approximately 4,128 tests in a 24-hour period.
targetString: Ngo-11 February 2020 lendlela yokuhlolwa yabhaliswa i-Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare. Ngo-12 March 2020, kwabikwa ukuthi i-Mayo Clinic isithuthuthukise uhlobo lokuhlolela ukuphathwa i-COVID-19. Ngo-13 March 2020, iRoche Diagnostics yathola imvumo ye-FDA yohlobo lokuhlola olungenziwa phakathi namahora angu-3.5 ngokwenza kanjalo kuvumele umshini owodwa ukuthi wenze ukuhlola okungu-4128 esikhathini esingamahora angu-24.
en-mt: On 11 February 2020 this testing method was registered with the Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare. On 12 March 2020, it was reported that the Mayo Clinic had developed a type of COVID-19 management test. On 13 March 2020, Roche Diagnostics obtained FDA approval for a type of test that can be performed within 3.5 hours by doing so allowing one machine to perform 4128 tests in a 24-hour period.

sourceString: On 19 March 2020, the FDA issued emergency use authorization (EUA) to Abbott Laboratories for a test on Abbott's m2000 system; the FDA had previously issued similar authorization to Hologic, LabCorp, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.
targetString: Ngo-19 March 2020, i-FDA ikhiphele i-Abbot Laboratories ukugunyazwa kwezikhathi ezibucayi ,i-EUA, ukuthi ihlole ngesimiso se-Abbott m2000, i-FDA ibikade inikeze i-Hologic, LabCorp ne-Thermo Fisher Scientific ukugunyazwa okufanayo.
en-mt: On 19 March 2020, the FDA issued Abbot Laboratories a critical time authorization ,EUA, to assess the Abbott m2000 regulation, the FDA had previously granted Hologic, LabCorp and Thermo Fisher Scientific similar authorizations.

sourceString: On 21 March 2020, Cepheid similarly received EUA from the FDA for a test that takes about 45 minutes.
targetString: Ngo 21-March 2020, i-Cepheid ngokufanayo ithole i-EUA nge-FDA yohlobo lokuhlola oluthatha imizuzu engabe ngu-45.
en-mt: On 21-March 2020, Cepheid similarly obtained the EUA through an FDA-type test that takes about 45 minutes.

sourceString: The FDA has approved a test that uses isothermal nucleic acid amplification technology instead of PCR.
targetString: I-FDA ivumele uhlobo lokuhlola olusebenzisa i-isothermal nucleic acid amplification technology esikhundleni se-PCR.
en-mt: The FDA has approved a type of test that uses isothermal nucleic acid amplification technology instead of PCR.

sourceString: Since this does not require a series of alternating temperature cycles this method can deliver positive results in as little as five minutes and negative results in 13 minutes.
targetString: Ngenxa yokuthi lolu aludingi uchungechunge lwemijikelezo yokubanda nokushisa, loluhlobo lunganikeza imiphumela e-positive emizuzwini emncane kangangemihlanu ne-negative emizuzwini engu-13.
en-mt: Because this does not require a series of cold and heat cycles, this type can provide positive results in as little as five minutes and negative in 13 minutes.

sourceString: There are currently about 18,000 of these machines in the U.S. and Abbott expects to ramp up manufacturing to deliver 50,000 tests per day.A test which uses a monoclonal antibody which specifically binds to the nucleocapsid protein (N protein) of the novel coronavirus is being developed in Taiwan, with the hope that it can provide results in 15 to 20 minutes just like a rapid influenza test.
targetString: Njengamanje kunemishini engase ibe ngu-18,000 e-U.S futhi i-Abbott ilindele ukukhuphula ukuqhiqizwa kwayo ukuze kwenziwe ukuhlola okungu-50 000 ngosuku. Ukuhlola okusebenzisa i-monoclonal antibody ngokukhethekile enamathela kwi-nucleocapsid protein, i-N protein, ye-novel coronavirus iyathuthukiswa e-Taiwan ngethemba lokuthi kungakwazi ukuthi lunikeze imiphumela emizuzwini engu-15 kuya kwengu-20 okufana njengokuhlolela i-influenza.
en-mt: There are currently up to 18,000 missions in the U.S. and Abbott expects to increase its testing to 50,000 tests a day. Testing using a monoclonal antibody specifically sticking to a nucleocapsid protein, N protein, of the novel coronavirus is being developed in Taiwan in the hope that it can provide results in 15 to 20 minutes similar to influenza screening.

sourceString: A March 2020 literature review concluded that "chest radiographs are of little diagnostic value in early stages, whereas CT [computed tomography] findings may be present even before symptom onset."
targetString: Ukubuyekezwa lwemibhalo lwango-March 2020 kwaphetha ngokuthi "ama-radiograph esifuba akasizi ngangako ezigabeni zokuqala kanti okutholwa i-CT, computer tomography, kungase kubekhona ngaphambi kokuba izimpawu zesifo ziqale ukubakhona.
en-mt: A March 2020 text review concluded that "chest radiographs are of no benefit in the early stages and CT, computer tomography, may be available before symptoms begin to develop.

sourceString: Typical features on CT include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacificities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution.
targetString: Izici ezivamile ze-CT zihlanganisa i-bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacifities ene-periheral, asymetricand posterior distribution.
en-mt: Common ct features include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacifities with periheral, asymetricand posterior distribution.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving and consolidation develop as the disease evolves.
targetString: i-Subpleural dominance, crazy paving ne-consolidation kuyakhula njengoba isifo siziguqula.
en-mt: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving and consolidation are growing as the disease changes.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan at the point of origin of the current pandemic has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: Inhlolovo eqhathanisa i-PCR ne-CT e-Wuhan endaweni okwaqala kuyo lolubhubhane lusikisele ukuthi i-CT izwela kakhulu kune-PCR kodwa ayinayo imininingwane , izici eziningi zayo zihambisana nezamanye ama-pneumonia nezinqubo zezifo.
en-mt: A study comparing PCR and CT in Wuhan at the start of the pandemic suggested that CT is more sensitive than PCR but lacks data, many of its features are associated with other pneumonia and disease procedures.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".As of March 2020, the CDC recommends PCR for initial screening.
targetString: Ngokuka-March 2020, i-American College of Radiology ikhuthaza ukuba "i-CT ingasebenziselwa ukuhlunga noma ukuhlolela i-COVID-19 okokuqala" Ngokuka-March 2020, i-CDC ikhuthaza i-PCR ekusefeni okokuqala"
en-mt: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT be used to filter or test for COVID-19 for the first time" By March 2020, the CDC recommends PCR on the filter for the first time"

sourceString: Part of the immune response to infection is the production of antibodies including IgM and IgG.
targetString: Ingxenye ye-immune response ekuphathweni yisifo ukukhiqizeka kwama-antibodies kuhlanganise -Igm ne I-gG.
en-mt: Part of the immune response to treatment is the production of antibodies including Igm and GG.

sourceString: These can be used to detect infection in individuals starting 7 days or so after the onset of symptoms, to determine immunity, and in population surveillance.Assays can be performed in central laboratories (CLT) or by point-of-care testing (PoCT).
targetString: Lezi zingasebenziselwa ukuhlola ukuba khona kwesifo kusukela sekudlule izinsuku ezingu-7 noma ngaphezulu kwaqala izimpawu zokuba nesifo, ukuze kubonakale ukungatheleleki nokuqashwa komphakathi. Ama-Assay angenziwa izikhungo zokuhlola eziyinhloko , ama-CLT, noma nge-point-of-care testing , i-PoCT.
en-mt: These can be used to assess the presence of the disease from 7 days or more after the onset of symptoms, to show social distancing and recruitment. Assays can be performed by primary testing centers, LTCs, or by point-of-care testing, PoCT.

sourceString: The high-throughput automated systems in many clinical laboratories will be able to perform these assays but their availability will depend on the rate of production for each system.
targetString: Izinga eliphakeme lokusebenza kwama-automated systems ezikhungweni eziningi zokuhlolela ezokwelapha lizokwazi ukusebenza ngama-essays kodwa ukutholakala kwawo kuzoxhomeka esivininini sokikhiqizwa kwayo ngayinye.
en-mt: The high level of automated systems in many medical testing centers will be able to work with essays but their availability will depend on the speed at which it is produced individually.

sourceString: For CLT a single specimen of peripheral blood is commonly used, although serial specimens can be used to follow the immune response.
targetString: Nge-CLT, sisodwa kuphela i-specimen se-peripheral blood esisebenziswa ngokujwayelekile, yize ama-specimen a-serial engasebenziselwa ukusabela kwamasosha omzimba.
en-mt: With CLT, we are the only peripheral blood specimen commonly used, although serial specimens can be used for immune response.

sourceString: For PoCT a single specimen of blood is usually obtained by skin puncture.
targetString: Nge-PoCT, i-specimen yegazi eyodwa ivame ukutholwa ngokujoja isikhumba.
en-mt: With PoCT, a single blood specimen is usually obtained by injecting the skin.

sourceString: Unlike PCR methods an extraction step is not needed before assay.On March 26, 2020, the FDA named 29 entities that provided notification to the agency as required and are now therefore able to distribute their antibody tests.
targetString: Ngokungafani nezindlela ze-PCR, isinyathelo sokuputshuzwa asidingekile ngaphambi kwe-essay. Ngo-26 March 2020, i-FDA yethula amagama ezinhlaka ezingu-29 ezabikela le-agency njengokudingekile futhi manje sezikwazi ukusakaza ama-antibody test azo.
en-mt: Unlike PCR methods, a crushing step is not required before an essay. On 26 March 2020, the FDA unveiled the names of 29 agencies that reported the agency as necessary and are now able to distribute their antibody tests.

sourceString: As of April 7, 2020, only a single test has been approved by the FDA under an emergency use authorization.In late March 2020, Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics and Epitope Diagnostics received European approvals for their test kits, which can detect IgG and IgA antibodies against the virus in blood samples.
targetString: Ngokuka-7 April 2020, yinye kuphela indlela yokuhlola evunyelwe i-FDA ngaphansi kokugunyazwa kwezimo ezibucayi. Ngasekupheleni kuka-March 2020, i-Euroiminium Medical Laboratoray Diagnostics and Epitome Diagnostics yathola ukuvunyelwa kwama-test kits ayo kwase-Europe angakwazi ukuhlolela ukubona ama-antibodies awe-IgG nawe-IgA ngokumelene ne-virus kuma-blood samples.
en-mt: As of 7 April 2020, there is only one testing method approved by the FDA under the authorization of critical conditions. In late March 2020, Euroiminium Medical Laboratoray Diagnostics and Epitome Diagnostics obtained approval for its European test kits that can be tested to detect IgG and IgA antibodies against the virus in blood samples.

sourceString: The testing capacity is several hundred samples within hours and therefore much faster than the conventional PCR assay of viral RNA.
targetString: Umthamo wokuhlola ungama-samples angamakhulu ambalwa phakathi nehora ngakho kushesha kakhulu kune-conventional PCR assay ye-Viral RNA.
en-mt: The test dose is a few hundred samples during the hour so it is much faster than the conventional PCR assay of Viral RNA.

sourceString: The antibodies are usually detectable 14 days after the onset of the infection.In early April, the UK found none of the antibody test kits it purchased were sufficiently good to use.
targetString: Ukuba khona kwama-antibodies kuvame ukuhloleka ngemva kwezinsuku ezingu-14 zokutholwa isifo. Ngo-April, i-UK yathola ukuthi yayingekho neyodwa kwama-antibody test kits eyayiwathengile ayezokwazi ukusebenziseka ngokuzuzisayo.
en-mt: The presence of antibodies is usually checked after 14 days of diagnosis. In April, the UK found that none of the antibody test kits it had purchased would be able to be used effectively.

sourceString: Hong Kong has set up a scheme where suspected patients can stay home, "emergency department will give a specimen tube to the patient", they spit into it, send it back and get a test result a while after.The British NHS has announced that it is piloting a scheme to test suspected cases at home, which removes the risk of a patient infecting others if they come to a hospital or having to disinfect an ambulance if one is used.In drive-through testing for COVID-19 for suspected cases, a healthcare professional takes sample using appropriate precautions.
targetString: E-Hong Kong kweziwe uhlelo lapho abasolwa ngokuba yiziguli bangahlala emakhaya, "umyango wezimo ezibucayi ozonikeza isiguli i-specimen tube", ukuze bakhafulele phakathi, bayibuyisele emuva bese bethola imiphumela ngemva kwesikhashana. I-British NHS imemezele ukuthi iqalisa uhlelo lokuhlolela emakhaya okuqeda usongo lokuthi isiguli sithelele abanye uma siya emtholampilo noma isidingo sokuhlanzela ukubulala amagciwane izithuthi zezuguli uma kukhona esisebenzisiwe. Mayelana nabasolwa ngokugula ezandaweni zokuhlolelwa i-COVID-19 ungehlile emotweni, isisebenzi sezempilo yiso esiyothatha ama-sample sisebenzisa ukuqhaphisisa okufanelekile.
en-mt: In Hong Kong a system has been created where alleged patients can stay at home, a "critical conditions fence that will provide the patient with a specimen tube", to break through, reverse it and get results after a while. The British NHS has announced it is launching a home screening programme to end the threat of a patient infecting others when they go to a clinic or the need to clean up disinfecting patients' vehicles if any have been used. As for those accused of getting sick in the areas of the COVID-19 test you don't get out of the car, it's the health worker who will take the samples using the right precautions.

sourceString: Drive-through centers have helped South Korea do some of the fastest, most-extensive testing of any country.In Germany, the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians said on 2 March, that it had a capacity for about 12,000 tests per day in the ambulatory setting and 10.700 had been tested in the prior week.
targetString: Izikhungo zokudlula-ushayela kusize i-South Korea yenze ukuhlola okushesha kakhulu, okugxile kakhulu kunoma iliphi izwe. E-Germany, i-National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians yakhuluma ngo-2 March, yathi inamadla okuqukatha ukuhlola okungaba ngu-12,000 ngosuku ngohlelo lokuthukusa futhi ukuhlola kwabangu-10.700 bekwenziwe ngeviki elidlule.
en-mt: Pass-driving centers have helped South Korea conduct very rapid, highly concentrated inspections in any country. In Germany, the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians spoke on 2 March, saying it had the capacity to contain about 12,000 tests a day through the shock program and 10,700 tests had been conducted in the past week.

sourceString: Costs are borne by the health insurance when the test is ordered by a physician.
targetString: Izindleko zithwalwa ngumshwalense wezezempilo lapho ukuhlola kubizwe ngudokotela.
en-mt: Costs are borne by health insurance when a check-up is called by a doctor.

sourceString: According to the president of the Robert Koch Institute, Germany has an overall capacity for 160,000 tests per week.
targetString: Ngokusho kukamongameli we-Robert Koch Institute, i-Germany inamandla okuqukatha ukuhlola abangu-160,000 ngeviki.
en-mt: According to the president of the Robert Koch Institute, Germany has the capacity to contain 160,000 tests a week.

sourceString: As of 19 March drive in tests were offered in several large cities.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-19 March ukuhlola ngokudlula-ushayela kwanikezwa emadolobheni amaningi amakhulu.
en-mt: Since 19 March pass-driving inspections have been offered in many major cities.

sourceString: As of 26 March 2020 the total number of tests performed in Germany was unknown, because only positive results are reported.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-26 March 2020 igqikithi yesibalo sokuhlola esenziwe yi-Germany besingaziwa, ngoba imiphumela eqinisile kuphela ebikwayo.
en-mt: As of 26 March 2020 the total number of tests conducted by Germany was unknown, because only the exact results were reported.

sourceString: A first lab survey revealed that as of calendar week 12/2020 a total of at least 483,295 samples were tested up to and including week 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.In Israel, researchers at Technion and Rambam Hospital developed and tested a method for testing samples from 64 patients simultaneously, by pooling the samples and only testing further if the combined sample is found to be positive.In Wuhan a makeshift 2000-sq-meter emergency detection laboratory named "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, or "Fire Eye" in English) was opened on 5 February 2020 by BGI, which can process over 10,000 samples a day.
targetString: Inhlolovo yokuqala yelebhu yabonisa ukuthi kusukela ngeviki lekhalenda u-12/2020 ingqikithi yamasampula okungenani angu-483,295 ahlolwa kwaze kwafika futhi kwahlanganisa iviki u-12/2020 namasampula angu-33,491 u-(6.9%) lapho kuhlolwa waqinisekisela i-SARS-CoV-2. I-Israel, abacwaningi e-Technion and Rambam Hospital bakhe futhi bahlola indlela yokuhlola amasampula eziguli ezingu-64 patients kanye kanye, ngokuhlanganisa amasampula nokuhlola okwengeziwe kuphela lapho isampula elihlanganisiwe libonisa ukuqinisekisa. E-Wuhan idokodo elingu-2000-sq-meter lelebhu yophenyo lwesimo esiphuthumayo elibizwa ngokuthi "Huo-Yan" (Umbhalo wesi-China: 火眼, noma "Iso Lomlilo" nge-English) lavulwa yi-BGI ngo-5 February 2020, likwazi ukuqhubeza amasampula angaphezulu kuka-10,000 ngosuku.
en-mt: The first lab study showed that as of calendar week 12/2020 a total of at least 483,295 samples were tested till arrival and included the week 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) when the test confirmed SARS-CoV-2. Israel, researchers at his Technion and Rambam Hospital also examined how to test samples of 64 patients once and for all, by combining samples with additional testing only when the combined sample showed confirmation. In Wuhan a 2000-sq-meter emergency research lab called "Huo-Yan" (China's text: 火眼, or "Eye of Fire" in English) was opened by BGI on 5 February 2020, capable of processing more than 10,000 samples per day.

sourceString: With the construction overseen by BGI-founder Wang Jian and taking 5-days, modelling has show cases in Hubei would have been 47% higher and the corresponding cost of the tackling the quarantine would have doubled if this testing capacity hadn't come on line.
targetString: Njengoba isakhiwo besenganyelwa umsunguli we-BGI u-Wang Jian futhi sathatha izinsuku ezingu-5, ukufuzisela kubonisa ukuthi izibonelo e-Hubei ngabe ziphezulu ngo-47% futhi izindleko ezifanele zokuhlangabeza ukuvalelwa bezizophindwa kabili uma amandla okuqukatha ukuhlola engazange atholakale ngesikhathi.
en-mt: Since the building was managed by BGI founder Wang Jian and lasted 5 days, the modeling shows that samples in Hubei would be 47% higher and the appropriate cost of meeting the lockdown would double if the capacity to contain testing was not available in time.

sourceString: The Wuhan Laboratory has been promptly followed by Huo-Yan labs in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, and Shanghai, in a total of 12 cities across China.
targetString: I-Lebhu yase-Wuhan ilandelwe ngokushesha amalebhu e-Huo-Yan e-Shenzhen, e-Tianjin, e-Beijing, nase-Shanghai, ingqikithi yamadolobha angu-12 cities kulo lonke elase-China.
en-mt: The Wuhan Lab was immediately followed by Huo-Yan labs in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, and Shanghai, a total of 12 cities across China.

sourceString: By 4 March 2020 the daily throughput totals were 50,000 tests per day.Open source, multiplexed designs released by Origami Assays have been released that can test as many as 1122 patient samples for COVID19 using only 93 assays .  These balanced designs can be run in small laboratories without the need for robotic liquid handlers.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-4 March 2020 ingqikithi yokudluliswayo kosuku ibe ukuhlola okungu-50,000 ngosuku. Umthombo ovulekile, imidwebo eyinkimbinkimbi ekhululwe yi-Origami Assays ivulelekile ukuze ikwazi ukuhlola amasampula eziguli amaningi kuze kufike ku-1122 e-COVID19 kusebenziswa ama-assays angu-93 kuphela. Lemidwebo elinganisa ngobuchwepheshe ingasebenza kumalebhu amancane ngaphandle kwesidingo samarobhothi abamba uketshezi.
en-mt: As of 4 March 2020 the total day transfer has been 50,000 tests per day. Open source, complex drawings released by Origami Assays are open so they can test samples of up to 1122 COVID19 patients using only 93 assays. These technically measuring drawings can work in small labs without the need for liquid-holding robots.

sourceString: By March, shortages and insufficient amounts of reagent has become a bottleneck for mass testing in the EU and UK and the US.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-March, ukuntuleka nesibalo esinganele se-reagent sesibe inkanankana yento ekuhloleni iningi phakathi ne-EU ne-UK kanye ne-US.
en-mt: Since March, the lack and insufficient amount of reagent has been equal to what in most inspections between the EU and UK and US.

sourceString: This has led some authors to explore sample preparation protocols that involve heating samples at 98 °C (208 °F) for 5 minutes to release RNA genomes for further testing.On 31 March it was announced United Arab Emirates was now testing more of its population for Coronavirus per head than any other country, and was on track to scale up the level of testing to reach the bulk of the population.
targetString: Lokhu kuholele ekutheni abanye abalobi bahlole izinqubomthetho zokulungiselela amasampula okuhilela ukushisisa amasampula ku-98 °C (208 °F) imizuzu engu-5 ukuze kudedeleke izakhi ze-RNA ezihlolwa ngokwengeziwe. Ngo 31 March kwamenyezelwa ukuthi i-United Arab Emirates manje ibisihlola inani labantu bayo elengeziwe ibheka i-Coronavirus ikhanda ngalinye kunanoma iliphi elinye izwe, futhi ibihamba ngonyawo oluhle ekukhuphuleni izinga lokuhlola ukuze ifinyelele ingxenye enkulu yenani labantu.
en-mt: This has resulted in some fishermen examining the regulatory procedures for preparing samples that involve heating samples at 98°C (208°F) for 5 minutes in order to defy the more tested RNA components. On 31 March it was announced that the United Arab Emirates was now assessing its additional number of people looking at Coronavirus per head than any other country, and was on a positive footing in raising the testing rate to reach a greater share of the population.

sourceString: This was through a combination of drive-through capability, and purchasing a population-scale mass-throughput laboratory from Group 42 and BGI (based on their "Huo-Yan" emergency detection laboratories in China).
targetString: Lokhu bekuyinhlanganisela yokuqukatha amandla okudlula-ushayela, nokuthenga i-population-scale mass-throughput laboratory ku-Group 42 ne-BGI (esekelwe ku-"Huo-Yan" emergency detection laboratories e-China).
en-mt: This was a combination of over-driving power, and purchasing a population-scale mass-throughput laboratory in Group 42 and BGI (based on "Huo-Yan" emergency detection laboratories in China).

sourceString: Constructed in 14 days, the lab is capable of conducting tens of thousands RT-PCR tests per day and is the first in the world of this scale to be operational outside of China.
targetString: Yakhiwe ezinsukwini ezingu-14, ilebhu ikwazi ukuqondisa amashumi ezinkulungwane zokuhlola nge-RT-PCR ngosuku futhi eyokuqala emhlabeni yalelizinga esebenzayo ngaphandle kwase-China.
en-mt: Built in 14 days, the lab is able to direct tens of thousands of RT-PCR tests per day and the first in the world of this level is effective outside China.

sourceString: Different testing recipes targeting different parts of the coronavirus genetic profile were developed in China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, and the United States.
targetString: Izinqubo ezingafani zokuhlola okuqonda kumalungu angafani ezakhi ze-coronavirus zakhiwa e-China, e-France, e-Germany, e-Hong Kong, e-Japan, nase-United States.
en-mt: Different cognitive testing procedures for different members of coronavirus structures are being developed in China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, and the United States.

sourceString: The World Health Organization adopted the German recipe for manufacturing kits sent to low-income countries without the resources to develop their own.
targetString: I-World Health Organization yakhetha inqubo yase-German yokwakhiwa kwamakhithi athunyelwa emazweni antulayo kwezemali angenazo izinsiza zokuzakhela awazo.
en-mt: The World Health Organization chose the German process for the construction of chemicals sent to financially developing countries that do not have the resources to build their own.

sourceString: The German recipe was published on 17 January 2020; the protocol developed by the United States Centers for Disease Control was not available until 28 January, delaying available tests in the U.S.China and the United States had problems with the reliability of test kits early in the outbreak, and these countries and Australia were unable to supply enough kits to satisfy demand and recommendations for testing by health experts.
targetString: Inqubo yase-German yanyatheliswa ngo-17 January 2020; inqubomthetho eyasungulwa yi-United States Centers for Disease Control ayizange itholakale kwaze kwaba ngu-28 January, kwalibazisa ukuhlola okutholakalayu e-U.S. I-China ne-United States babhekana nezinkinga zokuthembakala kwamakhithi okuhlola ekuqaleni kokuqubuka, futhi lamazwe ne-Australia awakwazanga ukwakha nokukhipha amakhithi anele ukwanelisa isidingo nokukhuthaza kpchwepheshe bezezempilo.
en-mt: The German process was published on 17 January 2020; the legal process established by the United States Centers for Disease Control was not available until 28 January, delaying testing available in the U.S. China and the United States faced confidence problems for testing kits at the start of the outbreak, and these countries and Australia were unable to build and produce enough kits to satisfy the need and promote healthcare professionals.

sourceString: In contrast, experts say South Korea's broad availability of testing helped reduce the spread of the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Ngokungafani, ochwepheshe bathi ukutholakala okubanzi kokuhlola e-South Korea kusizile kwanciphisa ukusabalala kwe-coronavirus entsha.
en-mt: In contrast, experts say the widespread availability of testing in South Korea has helped slow the spread of the new coronavirus.

sourceString: Testing capacity, largely in private sector labs, was built up over several years by the South Korean government.
targetString: Amandla okuqukatha ukuhlola, ikakhulukazi kumalebhu azimele, akhiwa esikhathini seminyaka eminingi nguhulumeni wase-South Korean.
en-mt: The capacity to contain testing, especially in independent labs, is built over many years by the South Korean government.

sourceString: On 16 March, the World Health Organization called for ramping up the testing programmes as the best way to slow the advance of COVID-19 pandemic.High demand for testing due to wide spread of the virus caused backlogs of hundreds of thousands of tests at private U.S. labs, and supplies of swabs and chemical reagents became strained.
targetString: Ngo 16 March, i-World Health Organization yabizela ukunikwa amandla kwezinqubo zokuhlola njengendlela engcono kakhulu yokunensisa ukungenisa kobhubhane i-COVID-19. Isidingo esiphakeme sokuhlola ngenxa yobubanzi bokusabalala kwegciwane kwabangela ukunqwabelana komsebebenzi wamakhulu ezinkulungwane kumalebhu ase-U.S. azimele, futhi ukukhishwa kwama-swabs nama-chemical reagents kwacindezela.
en-mt: On 16 March, the World Health Organization called for the empowerment of testing procedures as the best way to grace the importation of the COVID-19 pandemic. The high need for testing due to the extent of the spread of the virus resulted in the accumulation of hundreds of thousands of workers at U.S. labs. independent, and the release of swabs and chemical reagents was pressed.

sourceString: In March 2020 China reported problems with accuracy in their test kits.
targetString: Ngo March 2020 i-China yabika izinkinga ngokunemba kwamakhithi okuhlola ayo.
en-mt: In March 2020 China reported problems with the accuracy of its test kits.

sourceString: In the United States, the test kits developed by the CDC had "flaws;" the government then removed the bureaucratic barriers that had prevented private testing.Spain purchased test kits from Chinese firm  Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, but found that results were inaccurate.
targetString: E-United States, amakhithi okuhlola ayakhiwe i-CDC atholakala "enamaphutha;" uhulumeni wasusa izindonga zomthetho ebezivimbela ukuhlola ngasese. I-Spain yathenga amakhithi enkampanini yase-China i-Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, kodwa yathola ukuthi imiphumela yayinganembile.
en-mt: In the United States, TEST kits built by the CDC were found to be "flawed;" and the government removed legal walls that had prohibited private testing. Spain bought the kit from Chinese company Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, but found the results were inaccurate.

sourceString: The firm explained that the incorrect results may be a result of a failure to collect samples or use the kits correctly.
targetString: Inkampani yachaza ukuthi imiphumela eyiphutha kungenzeka ibangelwa ukwehlulela ukuqoqa amasampula noma ukusebenzisa amakhithi ngendlela efanele.
en-mt: The company explained that the side effects may be due to judging sample collection or using the kit properly.

sourceString: The Spanish ministry said it will withdraw the kits that returned incorrect results, and would replace them with a different testing kit provided by Shenzhen Bioeasy.80% of test kits the Czech Republic purchased from China gave wrong results.Slovakia purchased 1.2 million test kits from China which were found to be inaccurate.
targetString: I-Spanish ministry yathi izowakhipha amakhithi aveze imiphumela eyiphutha, futhi izofaka esikhaleni sawo amakhithi ahlukile ahlinzekelwe i-Shenzhen Bioeasy. U-80% owamakhithi okuhlola i-Czech Republic ewathenge e-China akhipha imiphumela eyiphutha. I-Slovakia yathenga amakhithi okuhlola ayizigidi ezingu-1.2 e-China atholakala ukuthi awanembile.
en-mt: The Spanish ministry said it would release the kit and produce the wrong results, and would put in its space the different kit provided by Shenzhen Bioeasy. 80% of the test kits the Czech Republic has purchased from China produce negative results. Slovakia bought 1.2 million test kits in China that were found to be inaccurate.

sourceString: Prime Minister Matovič suggested these be dumped into the Danube.Ateş Kara of the Turkish Health Ministry said the test kits Turkey purchased from China had a "high error rate" and did not "put them into use."The UK purchased 3.5 million test kits from China but in early April 2020 announced these were not usable.
targetString: I-Prime Minister u-Matovič waphakamisa ukuthi mawalahlwe ngokufakwa e-Danube. U-Ateş Kara we-Turkish Health Ministry uthe amakhithi okuhlola i-Turkeyewathenge e-China atholakala ene- "zinga eliphakeme lamaphutha" futhi awazange a-"asetshenziswe." I-UK yathenga amakhithi okuhlola eyizigidi ezingu-3.5 e-China kodwa ekuqaleni kuka-April 2020 yamemezela ukuthi awasebenziseki.
en-mt: Prime Minister Matovič proposed that he be rejected for being placed in the Danube. Ateş Kara of the Turkish Health Ministry said Turkey's test kits purchased from China were found to have a "high level of errors" and were not "used." The UK bought 3.5 million test kits from China but in early April 2020 announced they were unusable.

sourceString: Testing, followed with quarantine of those who tested positive and tracing of those with whom the SARS-CoV-2 positive people had had contact, resulted in positive outcomes.
targetString: Ukuhlola, kulandelwe ukuvalelwa kwalabo abatholakala beqinisekisa lapho behlolwa futhi kwalandelelwa labo bantu ababe nokuthintana nabantu ababonise ukuqinisekisa uma kuhlolelwa i-SARS-CoV-2, imiphumela ibe ukuqinisekisa nakhona.
en-mt: Testing, followed by the detention of those found to confirm when they were tested and followed by those people who had contact with people who showed positive for SARS-CoV-2 testing, the results were also confirmed.

sourceString: Researchers working in the Italian town of Vò, the site of the first COVID-19 death in Italy, conducted two rounds of testing on the entire population of about 3,400 people, about ten days apart.
targetString: Abacwaningi abasebenza edolobheni lase-Italy i-Vò, indawo yokufa kokuqala kwe-COVID-19 e-Italy, baqondisa ukujikeleza okubili kokuhlola wlonke inani labantu abangu-3,400, okungenani izinsuku eziyishumi ngokuqhela.
en-mt: Researchers working in the Italian city of Vò, the site of Italy's first COVID-19 death toll, are directing two cycles of testing for a total of 3,400 people, at least ten days in practice.

sourceString: About half the people testing positive had no symptoms, and all discovered cases were quarantined.
targetString: Okungenani ingxenye yabantu abaqisekisa lapho behlolwa babenganazo izimpawu, futhi zonke izibonelo ezatholakala zavalelwa.
en-mt: At least half of the people who performed the test were asymptomatic, and all samples found were blocked.

sourceString: With travel to the commune restricted, this eliminated new infections completely.
targetString: Njengoba ukuvakashelana kukhawuliwe, lokhu kususa ukuthelelana okusha ngokuphelele.
en-mt: As visits are restricted, this removes entirely new interactions.

sourceString: With aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, the 2020 coronavirus pandemic in Singapore has proceeded much more slowly than in other developed countries, but without extreme restrictions like forced closure of restaurants and retail establishments.
targetString: Ngokulandelela abathintiwe ngomdlandla, ukuvakasha okungenayo kukhawuliwe, ukuhlola, nokuvalela, ubhubhane luka-2020 lwe-coronavirus e-Singapore luqhubeke ngokunensa kakhulu kunamanye amazwe athuthukile, kodwa ngaphandle kwemingcele enzima njengokuphoqa ukuvalwa kwezitolo zokudla nezinye zokudayisa.
en-mt: By tracking those affected by the enthusiasm, restricted incoming tourism, testing, and lockdown, the 2020 coronavirus pandemic in Singapore has continued much more aggressively than other developed countries, but without tougher restrictions such as forcing the closure of grocery stores and other retail outlets.

sourceString: Many events have been cancelled, and Singapore did start advising residents to stay at home on 28 March, but schools reopened on time after holiday break on 23 March.
targetString: Izenzakalo eziningi zikhanseliwe, futhi i-Singapore yaqala ukweluleka izakhamuzi ukuthi zihlale emakhaya ngo-28 March, kodwa izikole zavula ngesikhathi ngemuva kwekhefu lamaholidi ngo-23 March.
en-mt: Many events were cancelled, and Singapore began advising citizens to stay at home on 28 March, but schools opened in time after the holiday break on 23 March.

sourceString: Several other countries have also managed the pandemic with aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, but with less aggressive lock-downs, such as Iceland and South Korea.
targetString: Amazwe amaningana nawo akwazile ukunakekela ubhubhane ngomdlandla wokulandelela abathintanile, ukukhawula uhambo lwangaphakathi, ukuhlola, nokuvalelwa, kodwa ngezinga elincane ekuvaleni-phansi, njenge-Iceland ne-South Korea.
en-mt: Several countries have also been able to care for the pandemic with the enthusiasm to trace contacts, restrict internal travel, testing, and quarantine, but to a lesser extent in lockdown, such as Iceland and South Korea.

sourceString: A statistical study has found that countries that have tested more, relative to the number of deaths, have much lower case fatality rates, probably because these countries are better able to detect those with only mild or no symptoms.
targetString: Ucwaningo lwezibalo luthole ukuthi amazwe ahlole ngokwengeziwe, uma kuqhathaniswa nesibalo sabafile, anezibonelo eziphansi zamazinga okufa, okungabangelwa isizathu sokuthi asesimweni esingcono sokuphenya labo abanezimpawu ezintukuntuku noma abangenazo nhlobo.
en-mt: Statistical research has found that countries that have examined more, compared to the death toll, have lower examples of mortality rates, which may be due to the fact that they are in a better position to investigate those with or without symptoms at all.

sourceString: WHO recommends that countries that do not have testing capacity and national laboratories with limited experience on COVID-19 send their first five positives and the first ten negative COVID-19 samples to one of the 16 WHO reference laboratories for confirmatory testing.
targetString: I-WHO ikhuthaza ukuthi amazwe angenawo amandla okuqukatha ukuhlola futhi anamalebhu esizwe anokuhlangenwe nakho okulinganiselwe nge-COVID-19 athumele amasampula aqinisekayo amahlanu okuqala nayishumi andulayo e-COVID-19 kweyodwa yamalebhu okuthenjwa angu-16 e-WHO azoqinisekisa ukuhlola.
en-mt: WHO recommends that countries that do not have the capacity to contain testing and have national labs with limited EXPERIENCE with COVID-19 send the first five confirmed and ten positive COVID-19 samples to one of the WHO's 16 trust labs that will confirm testing.

sourceString: Out of the 16 reference laboratories, 7 are in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America and 1 in Australia.
targetString: Phakathi kwamalebhu okuthenjwa angu-16, angu-7 ase-Asia, angu-5 ase-Europe, angu-2 ase-Africa, engu-1 ise-North America futhi engu-1 ise-Australia.
en-mt: Among the 16 trust labs, 7 are Asian, 5 are European, 2 are African, 1 are in North America and 1 are in Australia.

sourceString: In the following chart, the column “Positive as % of tests” is influenced by the country's testing policy.
targetString: Eshadini elilandelayo, ikholamu “Okuqinisekisayo % kokuhlola” kuthonywa inqubomgomo yokuhlola kwezwe.
en-mt: In the next chart, the column "Authentication % inspection" is influenced by the country's inspection policy.

sourceString: A country that only tests people admitted to hospitals will have a higher positive as % of tests than a country that tests all citizens, whether or not they are showing symptoms, other things being equal.
targetString: Izwe elihlola kuphela abantu abamukelwe ezibhedlela lizoba nabaningi abaqinisekiswayo nge-% yokuhlola kunezwe elihlola zonke izakhamuzi zalo, kungakhathaliseki ukuthi babonisa izimpawu yini noma cha, ezinye izinto zilingane.
en-mt: A country that only checks people admitted to hospitals will have more confirmed cases with a % test than a country that tests all its citizens, regardless of whether they show symptoms or not, other factors are equal.

sourceString: Hand washing (or handwashing), also known as hand hygiene, is the act of cleaning one's hands for the purpose of removing soil, grease, microorganisms, or other unwanted substances.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla (noma ukuwash'izandla), okaziwa futhi ngokuthi inhlanzeko yezandla, isenzo sokuzicoca izandla ngenhloso yokususa inhlabathi, ugrisi, izinto ezincane, noma izitaputapu ezingafuneki.
en-mt: Hand hygiene (or handwashing), also known as hand hygiene, the practice of hand sanitizer for the purpose of removing soil, grease, small objects, or unwanted drips.

sourceString: Hand washing with soap consistently at certain "critical moments" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases, for example diarrhoea and cholera, which are transmitted through fecal–oral route.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho ngokungalibali kulezo "zikhathi ezibucayi" phakathi nosuku kuvikela ukusabalala kwezifo eziningi, ngokwesibonelo uhudo nekholera, okuthelelana ngenqubo yendle–yomlomo.
en-mt: Washing hands with soap in a forgetful manner in those "critical times" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases, for example diarrhea and cholera, which are associated with the wild–oral process.

sourceString: People can also become infected with respiratory diseases such as influenza or the common cold, for example, if they do not wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (i.e., mucous membranes).
targetString: Abantu bangaphinde batheleleke ngezifo zokuphefumula njengomkhuhlane noma amakhaza avamile, ngokwesibonelo, uma bengahlanzi izandla zabo ngaphambi kokuzithinta amehlo, ikhala, noma umlomo (okungukuthi, izici ezisamafinyila).
en-mt: People can also be infected with respiratory diseases such as fever or common colds, for example, if they do not wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (i.e., features that are still short).

sourceString: The five critical moments during the day where washing hands with soap is important include: before and after defecation, after cleaning a child's bottom or changing nappies, before feeding a child, before eating and before and after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: Izinkathi ezibucayi ezinhlanu phakathi nosuku lapho ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho kubalulekile kuhlanganisa: ngaphambili nangemuva kokuzikhulula, ngemuva kokuhlanza izinqa zosana noma ukushintsha amanephi, ngaphambi kokufunza usana, ngaphambi kokudla nangaphambi nangemuva kokulungisa ukudla noma ukuphatha inyama engaphekiwe, inhlanzi, noma izinyoni ezifuywayo.
en-mt: The five critical periods during the day when washing hands with soap is essential include: before and after freeing, after cleaning baby diapers or changing diapers, before feeding a baby, before and before and after preparing meals or handling raw meat, fish, or pets.

sourceString: If water and soap are not available, hands can be cleaned with ash.The World Health Organization recommends washing hands:
targetString: Uma amanzi nensipho kungatholakali, izandla zingahlanzwa ngomlotha. I-World Health Organization ikhuthaza ukuhlanzwa kwezandla:
en-mt: If water and soap are not available, hands can be cleaned with ash. The World Health Organization recommends hand sanitizer:

sourceString: Before, during, and after preparing food.
targetString: Ngaphambi, phakathi, nangemuva kokulungisa ukudla.
en-mt: Before, during, and after preparing food.

sourceString: Before and after caring for a sick person.
targetString: Ngaphambi nangemuva kokunakekela umuntu ogulayo.
en-mt: Before and after caring for a sick person.

sourceString: After changing the diapers or cleaning up a child who has used the toilet.
targetString: Ngemuva kokushintsha amanephi noma kokuhlanza ingane ebisebenzisa indlu yangasese.
en-mt: After changing the tapes or cleaning the child who used the toilet.

sourceString: After blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Ngemuva kokufinya, ukukhwehlela noma ukuthimula.
en-mt: After sneezing, coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: After touching animal, animal feed, or animal waste.
targetString: Ngemuva kokuthinta isilwane, ukudla kwesilwane, noma ukungcolisa kwesilwane.
en-mt: After touching an animal, pet food, or animal contamination.

sourceString: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices related to medical procedures.
targetString: Inhlanzeko yezandla yezokwelapha ibhekisela ezindleleni zenhlanzeko ezihlobene nenqubo yezokwelapha.
en-mt: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene procedures related to the medical procedure.

sourceString: Hand washing before administering medicine or medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla ngaphambi kokunikeza umuthi noma usizo lokwelapha lungavikela noma kunciphise ukusabalala kwesifo.
en-mt: Washing hands before giving medication or medical help can prevent or reduce the spread of the disease.

sourceString: The main medical purpose of washing hands is to cleanse the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals which can cause harm or diseases.
targetString: Injongo eyinhloko yezokwelapha yokuhlanza izandla ukukhuculula ngokucoca izandla ama-pathogens (ama-bacteria, ama-viruses, noma amanye ama-microorganisms angabangela izifo) namakhemikhali angabangela ukulimala noma izifo.
en-mt: The primary medical purpose of hand sanitizer is to cleanse hands by cleaning the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause diseases) and chemicals that can cause injury or disease.

sourceString: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but also an important practice for the general public.
targetString: Lokhu kubaluleke kakhulu kubantu abaphatha ukudla noma abasebenza kumkhakha wezokwelapha, kodwa kuyinqubo ebalulekile ngisho nakumphakathi ovamile.
en-mt: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but it is an important process even for the general public.

sourceString: Hand washing has many health benefits, including minimizing the spread of influenza, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; preventing infectious causes of diarrhea; decreasing respiratory infections;
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla kunezinzuzo zempilo eziningi, kuhlanganisa ukunciphisa ukusabalala komkhuhlane, i-coronavirus, nezinye izifo ezithelelayo; ekuvikeleni izimbangela ezithelelanayo zohudo; ukunciphisa izifo zokuphefumula;
en-mt: Hand washing has many health benefits, including reducing the spread of flu, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; to prevent the associated causes of diarrhea; reduce respiratory diseases;

sourceString: and reducing infant mortality rate at home birth deliveries.
targetString: nokunciphisa izinga lokufa kwezinsana ekubeletheleni ekhaya.
en-mt: and reducing infant mortality rates at home delivery.

sourceString: A 2013 study showed that improved hand washing practices may lead to small improvements in the length growth in children under five years of age.
targetString: Ucwaningo lango-2013 lwabonisa ukuthi inqubo yokuhlanza izandla ethuthukile ingase iholele ezingeni elincane lokuthuthuka ebudeni bokukhula kwezingane ezingaphansi kweminyaka eyisihlanu.
en-mt: A 2013 study showed that an advanced handwashing process may lead to a small level of improvement during the development of children under the age of five.

sourceString: In developing countries, childhood mortality rates related to respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by introducing simple behavioral changes, such as hand washing with soap.
targetString: Emazweni asathuthuka, izinga lokufa kwabasha oluhlobene nezifo zokuphefumula nohudo lingancishiswa ngokuqalisa ushintsho lokuziphatha olulula, njengokuhlanza izandla ngensipho.
en-mt: In developing countries, the death rate for young people related to respiratory diseases and diarrhea can be reduced by initiating simple behavioral changes, such as soap washing hands.

sourceString: This simple action can reduce the rate of mortality from these diseases by almost 50%.
targetString: Isenzo esilula singanciphisa izinga lokufa ngalezizifo cishe ngo-50%.
en-mt: Simple action can reduce the death rate from these diseases by about 50%.

sourceString: Interventions that promote hand washing can reduce diarrhoea episodes by about a third, and this is comparable to providing clean water in low income areas.
targetString: Izindlela zokungenela ezikhuthaza ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho zinganciphisa iziqephu zohudo ngezinxenye ezintathu, futhi lokhu kungaqhathaniswa nokuhlinzekela amanzi ahlanzekile ezindaweni ezintulayo ngokwezimali.
en-mt: Interventions that promote soap washing of hands can reduce diarrhea episodes by three parts, and this can be compared to providing clean water to deprived areas financially.

sourceString: 48% of reductions in diarrhoea episodes can be associated with hand washing with soap.Hand washing with soap is the single most effective and inexpensive way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as automatic behavior performed in homes, schools, and communities worldwide.
targetString: Ukuncipha kweziqephu zohudo ngo-48% kungahlotshaniswa nokuhlanza izandla ngensipho. Ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho indlela eyodwa esebenza kahle futhi eyindleko encane ukuze kuvikelwe uhudo nama-acute respiratory infections (ARI), njengenqubo yokuziphatha ezenzekalelayo eyenzeka emakhaya, ezikoleni, nasemiphakathini emhlabeni wonke.
en-mt: A 48% reduction in diarrhea can be associated with soapy handwashing. Soap washing hands is one of the most effective and cost-effective ways to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), such as the self-contained behavior that occurs in homes, schools, and communities around the world.

sourceString: Pneumonia, a major ARI, is the number one cause of mortality among children under five years old, taking the lives of an estimated 1.8 million children per year.
targetString: Inyumoniya, eyi-ARI enkulu, ihola yodwa njengembangela yokufa kwezinsana ezingaphansi kweminyaka eyisihlanu, ichitha izimpilo zezingane ezilinganiselwa ku-1.8 wezigidi ngonyaka.
en-mt: Pneumonia, which is a major ARI, leads alone as a cause of death for infants under the age of five, destroying the health of an estimated 1.8 million children a year.

sourceString: Diarrhea and pneumonia together account for almost 3.5 million child deaths annually.
targetString: Uhudo nenyumoniya kokubili kunesandla ekufeni kwezinsana eziyizigidi cishe ezingu-3.5 ngonyaka.
en-mt: Diarrhea and pneumonia both have a hand in the deaths of about 3.5 million babies a year.

sourceString: According to UNICEF, turning hand washing with soap before eating and after using the toilet into an ingrained habit can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, cutting deaths from diarrhea by almost half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by one-quarter.
targetString: Ngokusho kwe-UNICEF, ukuguqula ukuhlamba izandla ngensipho ngaphambi kokudla futhi nangemuva kokusebenzisa indlu yangasese ukuthi kube umkhuba ogxilile kungasindisa izimpilo ezengeziwe kunanoma iliphi ikhambi elilodwa noma ukungenela kwezokwelapha, kunquma ukufa ngenxa yesizathu sohudo cishe ngengxenye nokufa ngezifo zokuphefumula ngengxenye eyodwa.
en-mt: According to UNICEF, converting soap washing hands before meals and after using the toilet to be a concentrated practice can save more lives than any single remedy or medical intervention, determining death for the cause of diarrhea almost in part and death from respiratory diseases in one part.

sourceString: Hand washing is usually integrated together with other sanitation interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programmes.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla ngokuvamile kuhlanganiswe ndawonye nokunye ukungenela kokuthutha udoti njengenxenye yamanzi, izinhlelo zokuthutha udoti nenhlanzeko (i-WASH).
en-mt: Hand cleaning is usually combined with other waste transport interventions such as water, garbage and sanitation systems (WASH).

sourceString: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted through direct physical contact.
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla kuphinde kuvikele kusifo se-impetigo esidluliselana ngokuthintana okuqondile.
en-mt: Hand washing also protects against impetigo disease that transmits through direct contact.

sourceString: A small detrimental effect of hand washing is that frequent hand washing can lead to skin damage due to drying of the skin.
targetString: Ingozi encane eba khona njengomphumela wokuhlanza izandla njalo ukulimala kwesikhumba okubangelwa ukoma kwesikhumba.
en-mt: A minor accident occurs as a result of frequent hand washing and skin damage caused by dryness of the skin.

sourceString: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive hand washing can lead to an itchy, flaky skin condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially common among health-care workers.
targetString: Ucwaningo lwama-Danish lango-2012 lathola ukuthi ukuhlanza izandla ngokweqile kungaba nomphumela wokuluma, nesimo sesikhumba esinoqweqwe esaziwa ngokuthi i-hand eczema noma i-hand dermatitis, okuyinto evame kakhulu kubantu abangabasebenzi bokunakekela impilo.
en-mt: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive handwashing can have a bite effect, with a skin-covered condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is more common in people who are health care workers.

sourceString: Too frequent hand washing is also seen as one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
targetString: Ukuhlanza izandla kaningi kuphinde kubonakale njengenye yezimpawu ze-obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
en-mt: Frequent handwashing is also seen as one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

sourceString: There are five critical times during the day where washing hands with soap is important to reduce fecal-oral transmission of disease: after using the bathroom (urination, defecation), after cleaning a child's bottom (changing nappies), before feeding a child, before eating and before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: Kunezikhathi ezibucayi ezinhlanu phakathi nosuku lapho ukuhlanza izandla ngensipho kubaluleke khona ukunciphisa ukudlulisela isifo ngenqubo yendle-ngomlomo: ngemuva kokusebenzisa indlu yangasese (ukuchama, ukuzikhulula), ngemuva kokuhlanza izinqa zosana (ukushintsha amanephi), ngamphambi kokufunza usana, ngaphambi kokudla noma ngaphambi/ngemuva kokulungisa ukudla noma kokuphatha inyama engaphekiwe, inhlanzi, noma izinyoni ezifuywayo.
en-mt: There are five critical times during the day when soap washing hands is essential to reduce the transmission of the disease through a wild-mouth procedure: after using the toilet (urination, self-release), after cleaning the baby's uterus (changing the bodies), by feeding the baby, before or before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or pet birds.

sourceString: Other occasions when correct handwashing technique should be practiced in order to prevent the transmission of disease include before and after treating a cut or wound; after sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose; after touching animal waste or handling animals; and after touching garbage.
targetString: Ezinye izikhathi lapho inqubo efanele yokuhlanza izandla kufanele ilandelwe ukuze kugwenywe ukudlulisela kwesifo kuhlanganisa ngaphambi nangemuva kokunakekela ukusikeka noma ukukulimala; ngemuva kokuthimula, ukukhwehlela, noma ukufinya; ngemuva kokuthinta uthuvi besilwane noma ukuphatha izilwane; nangemuva kokuthinta udoti.
en-mt: Sometimes when the proper hand cleaning procedure should be followed to avoid transmission of the disease including before and after care of cuts or injuries; after sneezing, coughing, or sneezing; after touching an animal's carcass or treating animals; and after touching the trash.

sourceString: In many countries, there is a low rate of hand washing with soap.
targetString: Emazweni amaningi, kunezinga eliphansi lokuhlanza izandla ngensipho.
en-mt: In many countries, there is a low rate of hand washing with soap.

sourceString: A study of hand washing in 54 countries in 2015 found that on average, 38.7% of households practiced hand washing with soap.A 2014 study showed that Saudi Arabia had the highest rate of 97 percent; the United States near the middle with 77 percent; and China with the lowest rate of 23 percent.Several behaviour change methodologies now exist to increase uptake of the behaviour of hand washing with soap at the critical times.Group hand washing for school children at set times of the day is one option in developing countries to engrain hand washing in children's behaviors.
targetString: Ucwaningo lokuhlanza izandla emazweni angu-54 ngo-2015 lathola ukuthi ngokwesilinganiso, u-38.7% wemikhaya ulandela inqubo yokuhlanza izandla ngensipho. Ucwaningo lango-2014 labonisa ukuthi i-Saudi Arabia yayinezinga eliphakeme kakhululu lamaphesenti angu-97; i-United States eduze naphakathi ngamaphesenti angu-77; ne-China ngezinga eliphansi kakhulu lamaphesenti angu-23. Izinqubo ezimbalwa zemikhuba sezikhona manje ekukhuphuleni ukwamukela umkhuba wokuhlanza izandla ngensipho ngezikhathi ezibucayi. Ukuhlanza izandla njengeqembu kwezingane zesikole ngezikhathi ezimisiwe zosuku enye yazo emazweni asathuthuka ukuze kugxiliswe ukuhlanza izandla emikhubeni yezingane.
en-mt: A handwashing study in 54 countries in 2015 found that on average, 38.7% of households follow a soap washing procedure. A 2014 study showed that Saudi Arabia had the highest rate of 97 percent; the United States near and medium by 77 percent; and China at a very low rate of 23 percent. A few routine procedures are now in place to increase acceptance of the practice of soap washing hands at critical times. Group hand washing for school children at set times of one day in developing countries to focus on hand washing in children's activities.

sourceString: The "Essential Health Care Program" implemented by the Department of Education in the Philippines is an example of at scale action to promote children's health and education.
targetString: I-"Essential Health Care Program" eyaqaliswa i-Department of Education e-Philippines iyisibonelo sesenzo sesibalo sokukhuthaza ezempilo zezingane nezemfundo.
en-mt: The "Essential Health Care Program" launched by the Department of Education in the Philippines is an example of statistical action to promote children's health and education.

sourceString: Deworming twice a year, supplemented with washing hands daily with soap, brushing teeth daily with fluoride, is at the core of this national program.
targetString: Ukukhipha izikelemu kabili ngonyaka, kuhambisane nokuhlanza izandla njalo ngensipho, ukuxubha nsuku zonke nge-fluoride, kuyinsika yohlelo lwezwe.
en-mt: Removing scales twice a year, accompanied by regular handwashing with soap, daily fluoride mixing, is a pillar of the country's system.

sourceString: It has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.
targetString: Iqaliswe ngempumelelo futhi nase-Indonesia.
en-mt: It was successfully launched again in Indonesia.

sourceString: Removal of microorganisms from skin is enhanced by the addition of soaps or detergents to water.
targetString: Ukususa ama-microorganism esikhumbeni kuba nakangcono ngokufakwa kwensipho noma okokuhlanza emanzini.
en-mt: Removing microorganisms from the skin is even better with soap or water purifier.

sourceString: The main action of soaps and detergents is to reduce barriers to solution, and increase solubility.
targetString: Umsebenzi oyinhloko wensipho nokokuhlanza ukunciphisa izinto ezivimba isixazululo, futhi zikhuphule i-solubility.
en-mt: The main function of soap and cleaning is to reduce the substances that block the solution, and increase solubility.

sourceString: Water alone is an inefficient skin cleanser because fats and proteins, which are components of organic soil, are not readily dissolved in water.
targetString: Amanzi wodwa awanele ekuhlanzeni isikhumba ngoba amafutha namaphrotheyini, ayizakhiwo zenhlabathi, awancibiliki kalula emanzini.
en-mt: Water alone is not enough to cleanse the skin because fats and proteins, which are soil structures, do not melt easily in water.

sourceString: Cleansing is, however, aided by a reasonable flow of water..
targetString: Kodwa ukuhlanza kusizwa amanzi agelezayo ngokwezinga..
en-mt: But vomiting is helped by water flowing at scale..

sourceString: Solid soap, because of its reusable nature, may hold bacteria acquired from previous uses.
targetString: Insipho eyiqhuzu, ngoba iyakwazi ukuphinde isebenze, ingase igcine igciwane elisele ekusebenzeni kwangaphambili.
en-mt: A foul soap, because it is able to re-function, may retain the remaining virus in previous functions.

sourceString: A small number of studies which have looked at the bacterial transfer from contaminated solid soap have concluded transfer is unlikely as the bacteria are rinsed off with the foam.
targetString: Isibalo esincane socwaningo olubheke ukudluliselwa kwegciwane elisuka ensiphweni eyiqhuzu ethole ukungcola siphethe ngokuthi akunakwenzeka njengoba amagciwane ehlambululeka kanye negwebu.
en-mt: A small number of studies looking at the transmission of a virus from a contaminated virus conclude that it is not possible as viruses are washed away with foam.

sourceString: The CDC still states "liquid soap with hands-free controls for dispensing is preferable".
targetString: I-CDC isaqhubeka nokuthi "insipho ewuketshezi nokulawula ngaphandle kwezandla kungcono".
en-mt: The CDC continues to say that "liquid soap and hands-off control are better".

sourceString: Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted to a health-conscious public.
targetString: Izinsipho eziqeda amagciwane zikhangiswe kakhulu amalungu omphakathi okhathalela ezempilo.
en-mt: Disinfectant soaps are widely advertised by members of the health care community.

sourceString: To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.
targetString: Kuze kube namuhla, abukho ubufakazi bokuthi ukusebenzisa ama-antiseptics noma ama-disinfectants asikiselwayo kukhetha ama-antibiotic-resistant organisms emvelo.
en-mt: To date, there is no evidence that using antiseptics or recommended disinfectants is a choice for natural antibiotic-resistant organisms.

sourceString: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.
targetString: Nokho, izinsipho ezi-antibacterial zinezimeleli ezivamile zama-antibacterial njenge-triclosan, enohlu elude lwama-resistant strains ama-organism.
en-mt: However, antibacterial soaps have common antibacterial properties such as triclosan, which has a long range of resistant strains of organisms.

sourceString: So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.
targetString: Ngakho, ngisho noma ama-antibiotic resistant strains engakhethiwe insipho e-antibacterial, kungenzeka ingakwazi ukusebenza kahle ngendlela edayiselwa yona.
en-mt: Thus, even though antibiotic resistant strains are not selected by antibacterial soap, they may not be able to work as well as they are sold.

sourceString: Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.
targetString: Ngaphandle kwalokho i-surfactant nesimeleli esivikela isikhumba, izakhiwo eziyinkimbinkimbi zingase zibe nama-acid (i-acetic acid, i-ascorbic acid, i-lactic acid) njengesilawuli se-pH, i-antimicrobially active benzoic acid nezinye izinakekeli zesikhumba (i-aloe vera, ama-vitamin, i-menthol, ama-plant extracts). Ukuhlolisisa okubanzi okuvela e-University of Oregon School of Public Health kwabonisa ukuthi izinsipho ezingenalutho zisebenza ngempumelelo ngendlela efanayo nama-consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps ane-triclosan ekuvikeleni ukugula nokususa amagciwane ezadleni.
en-mt: Besides surfactant and a protective agent for the skin, complex structures may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as a pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and other skin care products (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts). Extensive studies from the University of Oregon School of Public Health showed that empty soaps work as effectively as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps with triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from food.

sourceString: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.
targetString: Amanzi ashisayo ongakwazi ukuhlanza ngawo izandla awashisi ngezinga elifanele ukuze kufe amagciwane.
en-mt: Hot water with which you can clean your hands does not wash at the right rate to prevent germs from dying.

sourceString: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).
targetString: Amagciwane akhula kakhulu lapho ukushisa komziba kungu-(37 °C).
en-mt: Viruses grow most when the temperature of the patch is (37 °C).

sourceString: However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.
targetString: Kodwa, amanzi afudumele, anensipho asebenza kangcono kunamanzi abandayo, anensipho ekususeni amafutha emvelo abamba inhlabathi namagciwane.
en-mt: But, warm, soapy water works better than cold, soapy water in removing natural oils that hold soil and bacteria.

sourceString: Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.
targetString: Ngokuhlukile kokukholelwa inqwaba kodwa, ucwaningo lososayensi lubonisile ukuthi ukusebenzisa amanzi afudumele akunamthelela ekunciphiseni i-microbial load ezandleni.
en-mt: Ignored by many beliefs yet, scientific research has shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing microbial load on hands.

sourceString: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.
targetString: I-hand sanitizer noma i-hand antiseptic iyisimeleli senhlanzeko yezandla esingenziwe ngamanzi.
en-mt: Hand sanitizer or antiseptic hand is a representative of water-free hand hygiene.

sourceString: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.
targetString: Ekupheleni kwawo-1990 nasekuqaleni kwengxenye lekhulu yekhulu leminyaka lama-21, izimeleli zenhlanzeko yezandla ezingenziwe ngamanzi zokuhlikihla nge-alcohol (zibuye zaziwe ngokuthi ama-alcohol-based hand rubs, ama-antiseptic hand rubs, noma ama-hand sanitizers) aqala ukuthola ukuduma.
en-mt: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, non-alcoholic hand sanitizers (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.

sourceString: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.
targetString: Amaningi asekelwe ku-isopropyl alcohol noma i-ethanol eyakhuwe yahlanganiswa ngesimeleli esishubisayo njenge-Carbomer (i-polymer of acrylic acid) yenze kube ijeli, noma i-humectant njenge-glycerin ibe uketshezi, noma igwebu ukuze kube lula ukusebenzisa nokunciphisa isimo sokoma se-alcohol.
en-mt: Many based on isopropyl alcohol or diluted ethanol were mixed with a moist solvent such as Carbomer (a polymer of acrylic acid) made into gel, or humectant as glycerin into liquid, or foam to facilitate the use and reduction of alcohol drying status.

sourceString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
targetString: Ukufaka i-hydrogen-peroxide efakwe uketshezi iphakamisa umsebenzi we-antimicrobial nakakhulu. Ama-hand sanitizer ane-alcohol engu-60 to 95% abulala amagciwane ngempumelelo.
en-mt: The inclusion of hydrogen-peroxide in liquids raises antimicrobial activity even more. Hand sanitizers with alcohol of 60 to 95% effectively kill bacteria.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.
targetString: Ama-alcohol rub sanitizer abulala amagciwane, ama-multi-drug resistant bacteria (i-MRSA ne-VRE), i-tuberculosis, namanye amagciwane (kuhlanganise i-HIV, ama-herpe, i-RSV, i-rhinovirus, i-vaccinia, i-influenza, ne-hepatitis) ne-fungi.
en-mt: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and other viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.
targetString: Ama-alcohol rub sanitizers ane-70% ye-alcohol abulala u-99.97% (u-3.5 log ngokuncipha, ngokufanayo no-35 decibel ngokuncipha) wamagciwane ezandleni ngemizuzwana engu-30 ngemuva kokugcoba no-99.99% kuye ku-99.999% (4 kuya ku-5 log ngokuncipha) kwamagciwane ezandleni umzuzu ongu-1 ngemuva kokugcoba. Ama-hand sanitizers asebenza kahle kumagciwane futhi asebenze kancane kumagciwane athile.
en-mt: Alcohol rub sanitizers with 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log by shrinking, similar to 35 decibel by shrink) bacteria in the hands 30 seconds after rubbing and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log by shrink) of bacteria in hands 1 minute after rubbing. Hand sanitizers work well against bacteria and are less effective against certain viruses.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.
targetString: Ama-hand sanitizer enziwe nge-alcohol acishe angasebenzi nhlobo ku-norovirus (noma i-Norwalk) uhlobo lwamagciwane, imbangela eyinhloko ye-gastroenteritis ethelelanayo. I-hand antiseptic eyanele noma i-alcohol rub kumele isebenziswe ukuthi ithambise ngokuphelele noma imboze zombili izandla.
en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost completely ineffective in the norovirus (or Norwalk) type of virus, the main cause of infectious gastroenteritis. An adequate antiseptic hand or alcohol rub should be used to fully lubricate or cover both hands.

sourceString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
targetString: Ingaphambili nengemuva lazo zombili izandla nangaphakathi nasekugcineni kweminwe kuyahlikihlwa cishe imizuzwana engu-30 kuze kube yilapho uketshezi, igwebu noma ijeli isiyomile.
en-mt: The front and back of both hands and inside and at the end of the fingers are rubbed for about 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.

sourceString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.
targetString: Izingcina zeminwe kumele zihlanzwe nazo, zihlikihlwe ezintendeni zombili. I-The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention ikhuthaza ukuhlanza izandla kunokuhlikihla ngama-hand sanitizer, ikhakhulukazi lapho kusobala ukuthi izandla zingclolile.
en-mt: Fingertips should also be cleaned, rubbed in both tents. The U.S. Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends washing hands rather than rubbing them with hand sanitizer, especially when the hands are apparently scratched.

sourceString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.
targetString: Ukuphakama ekusebenziseni lezi zimeleli kungenxa yokusenza kwazo okulula namandla okushesha ukubulala ama-micro-organisms; kodwa, okufanele zisetshenziswe ukuze zithathe indawo yokuhlanza izandla efanele ngaphandle kwalapho insipho namanzi kungatholakali.
en-mt: The height in the use of these representatives is due to their simple and fast-acting ability to kill micro-organisms; but, which should be used to replace proper hand sanitizer unless soap and water is not available.

sourceString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.
targetString: Ukusebenzisa ama-hand sanitizer asekelwe ku-alcohol njalo kungabangela isikhumba esomile ngaphandle kwalapho uma kufakwe ama-emollient kanye/noma iziswakamisi zesikhumba ekuhlanganiseni.
